Writing for GURPS

66179.name: Roleplayer (Issue 10 - May 1988)
66179.description:
In This Issue

The Sparrials
New Hit Location Table
Character Points
Short Notes
The Isle of Night
Errata
GURPS Q&A
Coming Attractions

66180.name: Tapp
66180.description:
Tapp is a regional (Southwestern Germany / Wuerttemberg) traditional trick taking game with 36 Cards (4 suits, french cards from 6 up to Ace, worth 11 (ace), 10 (10), 4 (King), 3 (Queen), 2 (Jack) and zero (6,7,8,9)), with similarities to Skat, Binokel and Tarock. Each player gets eleven cards (3 player-game) three are laid aside as the "talon" or 8 cards (4-player-game) with 4 cards for the "talon". "Coeur" is always highest, the others are equal of value. There are different ways players can decide to "play". The one who "plays" does this against the other players (like in Skat). Usually ("trump game") you need 61 points to win the game.

Description and rules: http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tapp_%28Kartenspiel%29

66181.name: Roleplayer (Issue 11 - Aug 1988)
66181.description:
In This Issue

Ultra Tech Wants You
Basic Set, Third Edition
Short Notes
Secrets, A New Disadvantage for GURPS
GURPS Options
Using (and Abusing) Eidetic Memory
Grendel
One Solar System? What Good Is That?
New for GURPS
Erata
GURPS Q&A
Coming Attractions

66182.name: Roleplayer (Issue 12 - Dec 1988)
66182.description:
In This Issue

GURPS 3rd Edition — Bigger and Better
GURPS Q&A
Short Notes
Accentuating the Negative
New for GURPS
Changes to Firearms Damage
Horror Firearms and Explosives (p. H74)
GURPS Swashbucklers Designer's Article
Errata
Coming Attractions

66184.name: Salute!
66184.description:
The player will be able to classify the Officer ranks (O-1 to O-6) of Armed Services including Branch of Service, rank, device worn, and number/arrangement of stripes.

The objective is to get three of a kind, four of a kind, and/or a "straight" (consecutive string of Officer ranks) within any singular specific Armed Service. Each player takes his/her turn in reviewing their own hand, drawing one card from the draw deck, or selecting the first face-up card in the discard deck. Then, he/she discards one unwanted card, and the game proceeds to the next player.
If he has one of demanded combinations he shouts "Salute!" immediately. The remaining players are allowed one more turn to try to match, or exceed the hand of the player who commanded, "SALUTE!".
Every combinations score. The first player to total 500 points wins.

Components:
60 cards

66185.name: See de tea
66185.description:
Given a learning objective, the learner will be able to classify it in terms of the content/performance matrix.

The game is similar in several ways to Rummy.

To make a play, the player must hold a minimum of three cards that fit together in the matrix. These may be any combination of "kind," "level," or "objective" cards. For example, three "objective" cards of the same kind or type, two fact "objective" cards and a "FACT" card, or a remember fact "objective" card with a "REMEMBER" card and a "FACT" card. After three cards have been laid down, any related card can be added to the set. To begin another set, a minimum of three cards is required.
When the "draw" pile is used up, the round is over. Each player counts the number of "objective" cards they have played (do not count "kind" or "level" cards) and receives 1 point for each. Players with "objective" cards remaining in their hands must subtract 1 point for each.

Components:

16 "kind" cards (3 each: Fact, Concept, Procedure, Principle)
12 "level" cards (3 each: Remember, Use, Find)
33 "objective" cards

66186.name: Sentence Challenge Game
66186.description:
Theplayers shall be able to use the card game to practice/reinforce formulating complete sentences.

The players use the words on the cards that were dealt to him to construct a sentence. He is awarded the points assigned to each card used if it's agreed that this is complete sentence.
A game ends when: a) all of the cards have been dealt, or b)the score of any player reaches or comes closest to an agreed total (200 points suggested).

The person with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

Components:
144 cards

66187.name: Shape Search
66187.description:
Given the deck of cards described below, the learners will be able to perceive and communicate descriptions of objects by observing the fine details of those objects.

The game is structured like the game "Go Fish". The object of the game is to be the first to get rid of all your cards by completing books. Each book is composed of four cards. A photograph of an object has been divided into quarters. Each card of a book contains one of these quarter photographs. When the four cards of a book are arranged on a table a photograph of the object is perceived.

Components:
60 cards

boardgamehonor.19685: 2010 Deutscher Spiele Preis Best Family/Adult Game Winner

66188.description:
In Fresco, players are master painters working to restore a fresco in a Renaissance church.

Each round begins with players deciding what time they would like to wake up for the day. The earlier you wake up, the earlier you will be in turn order, and the better options you will be guaranteed to have. Wake up early too often, however, and your apprentices will become unhappy and stop working as efficiently. They would much rather sleep in!

Then, players decide their actions for the turn, deploying their apprentice work force to various tasks. You'll need to buy paint, mix paint, work on painting the fresco, raise money (which you'll need to buy the aforementioned paint!) by painting portraits, and perhaps even send your apprentices to the opera in order to increase their happiness. Points are scored mostly by painting the fresco, which requires specific combinations of paints, so you'll need to buy and mix your paints wisely, in addition to beating other players to the paints and fresco segments you would like to paint.

Fresco includes several expansion modules, so you can play without expansions for a lighter family game or add in expansions to vary play and increase the decision-making and difficulty, resulting in a very flexible game with a high replay value.
66188.name: Fresco

66189.name: Shape Shuffle
66189.description:
The player will be able to match plane figures and space figures by their figure illustration, word name, written description, and a photograph of an actual object with the related plane or space figure.

Each player in his turn either picks up the top card from the deck or the face upcard next to the deck. She or he then discards one card and places it face up on the discard pile so there are always ten cards in hand or tray.
Play continues until the first player who has Shape Shuffle goes out. To go out a player must have at least one 4 of a kind, either two more 3 of a kind, or another 4 of a kind and a 2 of a kind and scores for those.
Play continues until the first player reaches a score of 200 points.

Components:
56 cards

66190.description:
New York has the same game play as Dirk Henn’s Spiel des Jahres-winning Alhambra, but with the Spanish architecture being replaced by the skyscrapers of Manhattan. As in the original game, players collect four types of currencies and use those funds to purchase tiles that they assemble into their own mini-metropolis, connecting the paved street edges on the tiles to create a coherent network of roads. The building tiles come in six colors, and players score for their holdings three times during the game, earning points for having the most of a color as well as for their longest road.

Aside from the theme change and the associated new artwork, the gameboard is now larger with spots for both face-down and face-up tiles and a scoretrack that circles the edge of the board instead of zigzagging back and forth.

Re-implements:

Alhambra
66190.name: New York

66191.name: Shape Up
66191.description:
The players shall be able to identify simple shapes embedded within complex figures.

The object of the game is to create "shape sets". A set is made by collecting all the shapes contained within one of the square cards. Each shape in a set is worth one point. The player who has used the most shapes (not sets) at the end of the game wins; that is, sets containing more shapes are worth more points.

Compoents:
66 cards
- 26 complex shape cards
- 40 simple shape cards

66192.name: Shark Rummy
66192.description:
The learners will be able to differentiate sharks by matching the different anatomical parts to form a complete shark.

Gameplay is similar to rummy.
To go out a player must have 4 of a kind twice. A kind is defined as the four body parts of a particular shark. Also player scores 100 points then.
Play continues until the first player reaches a score of 500 points.

Components:
52 cards

66193.description:
Anton, the adventurous anteater, is out looking for food. Nosy as he is, he sticks his long nose into every termite hill he comes across, and it’s not just edible things that he turns up either. His main objective, however, is the termite queen and her general. They earn the most points at the end.

A dice game where players have to place dice one by one onto certain columns of different anthills in order to attain the majority and score the most victory points. Majorities are not all the players must think about, however, as players will also want to place their dice on certain spaces to collect various items, forming sets that are also worth points at the end of the game. The player that is best able to balance attaining majorities while also collecting items will likely be the winner.

The funny background illustrations show the Anton the anteater in trouble with the ants and termites as he explores their homes.
66193.name: It Happens..

66194.name: Skeleton Rummy
66194.description:
Skeleton Rummy is a card game designed to serve as a learning and review tool for novice anatomy students. The game is intended to provide an elementary overview of the human skeletal anatomy.

The object of the game is to eliminate all of the cards in a players hand. This can be done by forming pairs (melding). The game is over when any player has laid down all of the cards in his/her hand. The player who eliminates all of the cards first, wins the game.

Components:
52 cards

66195.name: Spiel mit Lukas: Torjäger
66195.description:
This game is part of the "Lukas Podolski game series

There are green and white circles on the board which are connected with white lines with numbers on it.
Each player gets a deck in one color (black or red) and draws four cards. The player that wins the toss begins the game. To pass the ball the player has to play a card with the number equal or higher than the number on the white lines. If a player plays the ball to a white circle he/she can play another card. Otherwise there is a duel between the two players.
Duel:
Each player has four cards (if a player doesn't have four cards, complete the cards, till you have four) Then both player place a card on the table, face down. When both players have chosen a crad, turn around the cards. The player with the highest number on the card, has ball control. That player can pass the ball along the board.

To score points, the player plays the number (or a higher number) indicated on the board in front of the goal. To keep track of the points, a player receives a goal-chip each time a goal is made. If a player runs out of cards, the player with the most points wins the game.

66196.name: Specahouse
66196.description:
The beginning contractor student will learn to equate particular design structures with appropriate construction materials, while becoming acquainted with amenities that can appreciate the value of homes. Players will be able to build a house to spec on time by completing the house first.

Each player begins to assemble the necessary elements for construction and to collect attribute/obstacle cards to increase property values by retrieving 1 card from the pickup or discard pile. Players scores for completed houses.
The player with the most points wins.

Components:
109 cards
The deck is composed of 7 house element cards with 58 variations, 21 thematic design cards, and 30 attribute/obstacle cards.

66197.description:
A boardgame about street-soccer.
Two players have a football team of 5 persons. Drawing cards and managing the hand are the way to succes.
Game will have an inbuild easy-to-go game (Kick'n'Run) for a comfortable entry into the game mechanics.
This game is part of the "Lukas Podolski game series".
Minimum Age and Playing for the two versions is different.
66197.name: Spiel mit Lukas: Dribbel-Fieber

66198.name: U-Build Monopoly
66198.description:
This version contains variable Hexes to create different courses for each individual game. Additionally, this makes for different durations from 30 up to 90 minutes. Modern 3D-Buildings like Skyscrapers, stadiums or parks are built on the hexes to create a "real" miniature city.
The rules are mostly similar to Monopoly. But with notable changes such as the hazard locations, and the skyscrapers.

66199.name: By Jingo: The Second Anglo-Boer War
66199.description:
A campaign system and battle for miniatures, nominally for 10mm figures but applicable to others.

This set of rules forms part of the Real Time Wargames series, in this case covering the Boer War colonial battles of the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

66200.name: Blood and Sand: The Mahdist Wars in the Sudan
66200.description:
A campaign system and battle rules for miniatures, nominally for 10mm figures but applicable to others.

This set of rules forms part of the Real Time Wargames series, in this case covering the Sudanese colonial battles of the late 19th century where the British and Egyptian armies fought the warriors of the Mahdi.

66201.description:
A campaign system and battle rules for miniatures, nominally for 10mm figures but applicable to others.

This set of rules forms part of the Real Time Wargames series, in this case covering the Seven Weeks War of the 19th century involving the Austrian, Prussian and minor nations armies.
66201.name: Wars of Empire I: The Seven Weeks War of 1866

66202.name: Wars of Empire II: To the Last Gaiter Button
66202.description:
Tactical battle rules for miniatures, nominally for 10mm figures but applicable to others.

This set of rules forms part of the Real Time Wargames series, in this case covering the late 19th century battles involving the French and Prussian armies in 1870.

66204.name: For, Lords, Tomorrow is a Busy Day: The War of the Roses
66204.description:
Tactical battle rules for the Wars of the Roses, covering medieval civil warfare in Britain in the late 15th century. The rules indicate use of 10mm figures but other scales are usable.

The rules emphasise the various arms within the armies of the warring factions, including men at arms, light and heavy cavalry, archers, handgunners and artillery. Rules are also provided for incidental troops such as pikemen and foreign mercenaries.

66205.name: The Eagle's Last Flight: Eagles & Empire I
66205.description:
Operational and grand-tactical rules for the 100 Days Campaign in 1815, covering the famous and decisive encounters between Napoleon, Bluecher and Wellington at a high abstract level. The rules indicate use of 10mm figures but other scales are usable.

The rules emphasise command and the various ineteractions between the arms of the warring factions including light and heavy cavalry, infantry and artillery.

66206.name: Playing Leap Frog
66206.description:
Corps level miniatures rules for World War One on the Western Front at a fairly abstract level. The rules indicate use of 10mm figures but other scales are usable.

The rules emphasise command of large scale units. The aim is to gain ground, trading off against casualty levels. The rules contain all the key features of Western Front warfare, including artillery, machine guns and trench warfare.

66207.name: Tableau chronologique de l'histoire universéle gravé en forme de jeu, avec l'exposition des règles de ce jeu et des faits historiques dont il est composé
66207.description: A French game for children made for an educational purpose. At the gameboard one can se over 100 circles with information about important people in history.

66210.name: GURPS Magic Spell Charts
66210.description:
From the front page:

These charts are a visual representation of the relationships between the hundreds of spells listed in GURPS Magic. They not only reduce the work required to determine the prerequisites for a spell, but also reveal the underlying organization of the colleges. For each college, they show how far can one progress at each level of Magery; which spells are central, prerequisites for most of the other spells in the college; and how much overlap there is with other colleges. The simple, open format allows for further customization. Color the boxes to show which spells a mage knows and instantly see which ones he is eligible to learn.

This new vector graphics version is less han 10% the file size of the old edition; Also, all known errata to date have been corrected.

66211.name: Roleplayer (Issue 14 - Jun 1989)
66211.description:
First issue with color and a more conventional cover.

In This Issue

A Bigger Roleplayer
Short Notes
GURPS Q&A
Weapons and Armor in GURPS Space by Mike Hurst
Calling All Beasties
New for GURPS
Coming Attractions

66213.description: Monopoly with a circular board. No paper money is used, instead it uses a credit card setup with an electronic device that also substitutes chance cards and produces sound effects and music according to the events of the game.
66213.name: Monopoly Revolution

boardgameimplementation.38637: Age of Scheme: Routes to Riches

109106.name: Samarkand: Routes to Riches – Family Connection

boardgameissuearticle.26532: Not a Matter of Love, But Marriages Abound

66214.description:
As members of merchant families in Samarkand: Routes to Riches, the players marry into other wealthy merchant families. They expand the trading routes of these families and establish trade relationships with other families. The player who gains the most victory points with relationships and goods will be the winner at the end of the game.

Each turn, the players either marry into a merchant family or expand the trading route of a family they are already married into.

To marry into a family, the player pays the cost of the family. Only two players may marry into each family. To expand the trading route of a family, the player must be married into the family and may pay for the route with the money of the family. The goal is to meet other families not met before (gaining trade relationship markers) and to reach goods spaces first (gaining goods tokens).

When all families have established at least one trade relationship or one family has established five trade relationships, the game ends. Each player scores their goods cards with the corresponding goods markers they have acquired, the trade relationship markers they have collected, and their money.

This entry has been split from the Winsome Games publication Age of Scheme: Routes to Riches. As the rules have been altered, number of players differs, and updates to the artwork have been made, the two games are regarded as separate entities.
66214.name: Samarkand: Routes to Riches

66215.name: Nyse
66215.description: Nice (Nyse)! You can make tens of millions of dollars in ten-minute’s time on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE), as long as you are willing to exploit hard working regular people around the world by creating, manipulating, or collapsing speculative markets, aggressively investing, restricting investments, and forcing stock swaps on others . . . none of which is very nice.

66216.name: Bounties and Warrants
66216.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Bounties & Warrants is Strontium Dog supplement packed full of missions for budding bounty hunters. From petty thieves to genocidal maniacs, from lone assassins to fortresses packed full of criminals, players will have to be cautious and inventive if they are to maximise their profits, and bring back their targets – alive, not dead!

Using the Traveller core rules, Strontium Dog allows players to take the part of mutant bounty hunters, combing the galaxy for their prey – dead or alive!

Requires a copy of the Traveller rulebook.

66218.name: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire? (2nd Edition)

boardgamefamily.6027: TV Series: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire

66218.description:
Ask the audience what they think of "Who Wants to be a Millionaire? II" and the answer certainly won't be 50-50: they'll love it.

Based on the hit TV show that has pulled record audience figures around the world, the game is much as it is onscreen: you must answer increasingly difficult general knowledge questions in sequence, without getting any wrong, to win larger and larger amounts of money (in this case, fictional cash!). You have three lifelines, 50-50, Ask the Audience and even Phone A Friend, but once they're gone you're on your own. The questions in this new version have been updated, so even addicted players of the first edition will have plenty to go at.

Cards replace Chris Tarrant and a board replaces the TV studio, but otherwise the atmosphere can be every bit as electric as the real thing. So go on, give it a try. You may just be the next paper Millionaire! --Sophie Lowe

Each of these games contains a "golden ticket", giving the holder a chance to win a visit to the "Who Wants to be a Millionaire" studio to meet Chris Tarrant and play the game for real.

66219.name: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire? Entertainment

boardgamefamily.6027: TV Series: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire

66219.description:
Manufacturer's Description
A new way of playing the board game based on the popular TV quiz show. The host uses a score pad to plot the progress of the players whilst testing them with questions on all types of Entertainment.

Tension and excitement builds up as the players get closer to the million, and as in the TV show, they can use their lifelines.

66220.name: Who Wants To Be a Millionaire? Sport & Leisure

boardgamefamily.6027: TV Series: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire

66220.description:
Manufacturer's Description
A new way of playing the board game based on the popular TV quiz show. The host uses a score pad to plot the progress of the players whilst testing them with questions on all types of Sports and Leisure activities.

Tension and excitement builds up as the players get closer to the million, and as in the TV show, they can use their lifelines.

66221.name: Lexico SWE-ENG
66221.description: Unique dictionary game is now completely renovated! Lexico contains a total of 9000 commonly used words, divided into five thematic areas: Human, Environment, Nature and Hobby, Science and Technology as well as the general words. Three different levels of difficulty thanks to the game is suitable for all ages and levels of language minds can play together - each of the chosen level of difficulty. Lexicon company you enjoy and learn a foreign language!

66222.name: Frågespelet om Sveriges Kungahus
66222.description: Crown Princess Victoria and Princess Madeleine married! The game with the 1250 issues of Sweden's Royal Family is overdue! Here you answer questions on everything from Jean Baptiste Bernadotte to Silvia Nobel Blisters. The questions are divided into five categories: Bernadotte's predecessor, 1800s, 1900s, New & mixed and Castles & mansions. Win a crown for the right answer in each category, go to the center and answering the final question. The game is published in a limited and numbered edition exclusive to wooden pieces in velvet bag and velvet posts and gold foil on the cover.

66223.name: Sverige-Chansen
66223.description: An entertaining and different knowledge about Sweden game for the whole family. The players must decide whether a more or less unbelievable assertion is true or not and also how safe it is in their response. Are you very confident and has the right to take it up faster, but also look up so you can not move backwards. First Case After traveling all over Sweden have won.

66224.name: NYA Familjens Frågespel
66224.description: Experience the laughter and excitement in the family's favorite quiz. This way is on issues of 385 fun topics about everything between heaven and earth, from animals in Africa and signed figure to mobile phones and planets. The questions fit the flesta and there is some addition, special issues for the youngest. Answering questions in your favorite subject and try to win as much money as possible on your skills. When the timer starts ticking, you have 15 seconds to respond. While stress co pillars you through placing the chance cards which means they probably know the answer and want to "steal" your question. The player with the most money at the end of the game will be the family champion.

66225.name: Lättlurad?
66225.description:
From publisher:
Tell them the truth - except the gullible! Take a card that says how you are, whoever you are, what you do or where. Fool your friends into believing that you are telling the truth when you do not. Or, make them believe that you are telling the truth but actually prefer a waltz. Chance cards add an extra voltage moments and try your creativity. Buckling liars and speed up the proceedings - the first player to have won the case!

66229.name: LogIQ: Ω Omega
66229.description:
From publisher:
Challenge yourself and your friend with this fast-paced IQ duel game. Each product includes tasks divided into different task types, covering everything from number sequences to 3D problems and analogies. Put that grey matter to work and win the tasks by being the fastest one to solve the tricky problems!

66230.name: LogIQ: Φ Phi
66230.description:
From the publisher:
Challenge yourself and your friend with this fast-paced IQ duel game. Each product includes tasks divided into different task types, covering everything from number sequences to 3D problems and analogies. Put that grey matter to work and win the tasks by being the fastest one to solve the tricky problems!
Game 2 in series of 4!

66231.name: LogIQ: Ψ Psi
66231.description:
From the publisher:
Challenge yourself and your friend with this fast-paced IQ duel game. Each product includes tasks divided into different task types, covering everything from number sequences to 3D problems and analogies. Put that grey matter to work and win the tasks by being the fastest one to solve the tricky problems!
Game 3 in a series of 4.

66232.name: LogIQ: Ξ Xi
66232.description:
From the publisher:
Challenge yourself and your friend with this fast-paced IQ duel game. Each product includes tasks divided into different task types, covering everything from number sequences to 3D problems and analogies. Put that grey matter to work and win the tasks by being the fastest one to solve the tricky problems!
Game 4 in a series of 4!

66236.name: Goda grannar
66236.description:
From the publisher:
The biggest yacht, the fastest car, the hottest spouse and the most magnificent house – collect all the luxuries and make your neighbors green with envy, at the same time keeping a close eye on them. But remember that even the grandest empire may fall, so watch out for that nasty mother-in-law! The game where you treat your neighbors the way you always wanted to but never had the guts!

The game can be played up to 6 players. The game has four goals in the each corner of the board: the fastest car, the biggest yacht, the hottest spouse and the biggest and most expensive house. In the middle of the board you have deck of cards you use to get pieces you need to get next best thing in one of the four possible things. You move your playing piece around the cards and if you get the number necessary you can enter to the out of four big goal corners and try to get yourself the next best thing available! You win the game when the mother-in-law gets you and you have the most (better) stuff!

66237.name: UrbanMayhem: Streets of Mayhem
66237.description:
Publisher Blurb:

WorldWorks brings our world renowned texturing and model design skills into full play with this unique and highly useful model genre. No more make shift streets, felt marker grids or poorly rendered tiles for you! Each item included is hand textured from scratch with an attention to detail like no other product out there. Streets come to life with litter, dirt, cracks, oil stains and chipping paint, your players won’t believe their eyes! We not only give you 10 exquisitely detailed vital road and rail tiles in all 3 popular formats (1-inch, 1.5-inch and no Grid)...

* Crossroads
* T-Intersection
* Curved Street
* Straight Street
* Wasteland Tile
* Parking Lot (In two formats)
* Curved Rail
* Straight Rail
* Railroad Crossing

...but we also include 4-inch high stackable 3-D bridges for added dimension...

* Subway Ramp
* Straight Bridge
* Curved Bridge

...and to top it all off we’ve included a variety of atmosphere building 3-D props...

* 2 styles of street lamps
* Traffic lights
* 10 varieties of street signs with posts
* 3-inch high pedestrian overpasses
* Billboards with front and back ledges for figure placement (3 unique billboard signs & blank templates included)
* Concrete blockades
* Construction horses
* Subway entrances
* Train gate with swinging arm
* Pothole damage markers.

As an added bonus we’ve included both standard tiles and WorldWorks very own “PaperlinX” tile and tab system. We show you how to properly mount your tiles for added longevity and tie them all together with a unique series of tabs for on-the-fly game play. Change up your layout with ease and rest easy knowing that it won’t move when the table is banged by the group klutz ;)

New to paper modeling? Well worry not because you are in expert hands with WorldWorks. We hold your hand with detailed fully photographed, step-by-step instructions that make the process so easy you’ll wonder why you took so long to get started. Add to that a thriving community of WorldWorks enthusiasts who are eager to help out and offer friendly advice. You really can’t go wrong with WorldWorks, just look at some of our customer comments and you’ll quickly find that we are there for you the gamer!

So what are you waiting for? Your city requires the absolute mayhem that only you can give it!

66238.description:
For ages 8+
2-6 players
This is the 2nd version of Pokemon Monopoly.
Includes:

* 6 collectible Pokemon movers - Chikorita, Totodile, Marill, Cyndaquil, Bellossom, Pikachu
* 32 Plastic Poke' Centers and 12 Poke' Marts to improve your Pokemon's strength
* 28 Pokemon Deed cards and 7 denominations of Pokemon-themed play money
* 16 Ash cards and 16 Professor Elm cards, replacing the traditional Community Chest and Chance cards
* Special optional Poke' Rules and full-colour Gameboard

Game info:
In this Gold and Silver Pokemon edition of the classic Monopoly game, you'll travel around the board in search of Pokemon from the Johto World. The more Pokemon you collect, the more powerful a trainer you become. Add Poke' Marts and Poke' Centers to make your Pokemon even stronger. Ash cards and Professor Elm cards may bring rewards or other surprises. Bargain, trade and fight with other trainers to collect the most powerful Pokemon team and win the game!
66238.name: Monopoly: Pokémon Gold and Silver

66240.name: What Everyone Should Know About TRENDS & LIFESTYLES
66240.description:
From the publisher:
This game covers the whole scale from haute couture to everyday trends. Do you know which international fashion house uses the initials LV, or which animal appears on the Lamborghini logo? If you don’t, find out with What everyone should know about trends and lifestyles!
On each turn players take one card and try to answer to the question on there! When getting the answer right you get 10 of the money the game uses! Then you have another change to go! Get it right again, you get 20, then 50, then 100 and then you have to give away your turn!
You win the game when collecting amount of money agreed with other players at the beginning of the game! For example you win, when you get 250 that money!

66241.name: What Everyone Should Know About TRAVELLING IN EUROPE
66241.description:
From the publisher:
This game will take you on a trip to Europe. Everyone knows the leaning tower of Pisa, but do you know why it doesn’t stand straight? If you don’t, find out with What everyone should know about traveling in Europe!
On each turn players take one card and try to answer to the question on there! When getting the answer right you get 10 of the money the game uses! Then you have another change to go! Get it right again, you get 20, then 50, then 100 and then you have to give away your turn!
You win the game when collecting amount of money agreed with other players at the beginning of the game! For example you win, when you get 250 that money!

66242.name: Lexico UK-FR
66242.description:
From the publisher:
A unique dictionary game – now you can have fun while learning French! Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words divided in five categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The three difficulty levels make it possible for each player to play on the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills. A game that all family can play together and learn languages at the same time!

66243.name: What Everyone Should Know About GREAT INVENTIONS
66243.description:
From the publisher:
This game makes the cogwheels of your brain turn. Do you know who invented the bicycle, and how Blu-ray differs from DVD? If you don’t, find out with What everyone should know about the greatest inventions!
On each turn players take one card and try to answer to the question on there! When getting the answer right you get 10 of the money the game uses! Then you have another change to go! Get it right again, you get 20, then 50, then 100 and then you have to give away your turn!
You win the game when collecting amount of money agreed with other players at the beginning of the game! For example you win, when you get 250 that money!

66244.name: What Everyone Should Know About THE AMAZING EARTH
66244.description:
From the publisher:
This game will take you to the hottest deserts and the deepest oceans, and even beyond the Moon! Do you know how many bridges cross the Amazon River, or what causes solar eclipses? If you don’t, find out with What everyone should know about the amazing Earth!
On each turn players take one card and try to answer to the question on there! When getting the answer right you get 10 of the money the game uses! Then you have another change to go! Get it right again, you get 20, then 50, then 100 and then you have to give away your turn!
You win the game when collecting amount of money agreed with other players at the beginning of the game! For example you win, when you get 250 that money!

66245.name: Party Alias (Travel)
66245.description:
From the publisher:
The funtastic party game in a handy travel size edition! Party Alias is a hilarious version of the popular word explaining game Alias – a word game with a twist! The words are explained in completely new and crazy ways whenever the team lands on one of the Party spaces. You might get to tell a crazy story that includes all the words on a card, describe celebrities, or try to explain the words without using a certain letter. You also get to explain words in different moods – will you be hysterical, depressed or angry? Party Alias challenges everyone to explain, get active and use their creativity!

This travel version is different from the first Party Alias. It uses dice instead of a spinner, has fewer cards, and the story telling cards are made a little shorter (only 4 required to get the bonus).

66248.description:
From the publisher:
The game includes a total of 600 Norway concerning questions! By responding to the questions you tick off the pyramid in your subject areas. You be the first to check off 5 circles, you are a winner!
66248.name: Norge Quiz Junior resespill

66249.name: Lexico NO-UK
66249.description:
From the publisher:
Unique dictionary game is now completely renovated! Lexico contains a total of 9000 commonly used words, divided into five thematic areas: Human, Environment, Nature and Hobby, Science and Technology as well as the general words. Three different levels of difficulty thanks to the game is suitable for all ages and levels of language minds can play together - each of the chosen level of difficulty. Lexicon company you enjoy and learn a foreign language!

66251.description: The Pacific Ocean, 1835. The ship „HMS Beagle“ arrives at the Galápagos islands. On board is the young biologist Charles Darwin, who is later to become famous throughout the world for his revolutionary ideas of evolution and natural selection. However, before this, he spent much of his time collecting and examining a variety of different species. In this game, the players are biologists walking in the footsteps of Darwin. They go on expeditions on the Galápagos islands in order to discover rare species, and create exhibitions to score exhibition points. The player with the most exhibition points when the game ends wins the game
66251.name: Galapagos

66252.name: Camp Fire Girls Game
66252.description: The object of this game is to try and enter the "Council Fire" while collecting as many 'Honor Beads' as possible while on the way around the board. The player capturing the most points in Honors wins the game. One unusual part of this game is that players all play at the same time. There are no turns in the game, so no waiting for your turn before you play. The winner is the player who captures the most Honors, not neccesarily the person who finishes the game first. You must get to the "Log Cabin Council Fire" by exact count in order to end the game.

66253.name: County Fair
66253.description: This is a card game. There are 3 classes of cards, cards called Sellers, cards with pictures on them called Spectators and money cards. The Seller cards and the Spectator cards are shuffled to form their own decks. The start player draws a Seller card to see what they have to sell and the selling price for the item and then a Spectator card to see if they draw a person willing to buy whats for sale. If they get that combination of an item and a willing seller the player takes the amount of money shown on the Sellers card out of the 'bank'. Some cards show 'no sale' There are also two 'pretty girl' cards, one will buy and one will sell. There is also a 'constable card' which if drawn, the player drawing the card is immediately arrested and so losses his/her turn. When the seller cards are exhausted the game ends and whoever has the most money wins.

66254.description:
Do you have the right cards to be a good cat? To be a bad cat? Can you trick your friends into giving you the cards you need? Do you think you know your friends well enough to know when they’re bluffing? Will you keep them from getting a point or help them?

At the end of the day were you the kind of cat you wanted to be? Everyone will know if you’ve been a good cat or a bad cat!

Good Cat Bad Cat is a game of strategy, bluffing, and paranoia! What else would you expect from a game about cats?

Good Cat Bad Cat is a fast paced game that is easy to learn!

Note: In addition to the cards, you will need 6 CCG sized card sleeves or something similar to use for the card envelopes. A pencil and paper are also needed to keep scores!
66254.name: Good Cat Bad Cat

66256.name: Triplica
66256.description:
Players compete by placing cards to line up three in a row of the shape that matches their secret Goal. The first player to score five Goals wins! But beware... placing a card can help your opponents as easily as it can help you!

Triplica includes two multi-player games and a highly addictive solitaire version. With three ways to play, choose the version that is best for you. Triplica combines a mix of strategy and luck, and is easy to learn and fun to play.

66258.name: Arena
66258.description:
Arena is a four-in-a-row game, much like Connect Four or Score Four, with two distinguishing features:

Players alternately place/stack pieces along a wrap-around circular/cylindrical path instead a grid.
The board is not divided into discrete spaces; pieces are considered neighbors until a piece is laid between them.

66259.description:
From the publisher:
In this Alias game with all your TV favorites, you must explain the words and images to your team without mentioning the word to be explained. You may use synonyms, clues, etc. The number of correctly guessed words matches the number of fields which the team must move up on the gameboard. First Team to finish wins.
66259.name: Junior Alias med Bamse & Kylling, Kaj & Andrea og Anna & Lotte

66260.name: Engelsk ParlØr-Spil
66260.description:
From the publisher:
English phrasebook games with 250 practical words and phrases that you need, when you're traveling. To win the game you must translate words and phrases correctly and deleting categories in your triangle. You can play alone for training your travel English. Convenient format for luggage. A fun way to train travel in English!

66261.name: Lexico DK-UK
66261.description:
From the publisher:
Unique dictionary game is now completely renovated! Lexico contains a total of 9000 commonly used words, divided into five thematic areas: Human, Environment, Nature and Hobby, Science and Technology as well as the general words. Three different levels of difficulty thanks to the game is suitable for all ages and levels of language minds can play together - each of the chosen level of difficulty. Lexicon company you enjoy and learn a foreign language!

66262.name: He & She Travel
66262.description:
From the publisher:
Straight couples game in travel version now. Game is about to find out how well couples know each other. The game can be played by couples against couples or one couple. In order to advance in play the answer sheets must fit together. First couple to reach target wins the game. If a single pair is playing, so the aim is to find out who know their partner best.

66263.name: Europa: Quizzen om Europa
66263.description:
From the publisher:
An exciting quiz for Europe - now in handy travel version. The game contains 600 questions, divided into six categories: History, Culture, Technology and Natural Science, Geography, Sports and Mixed. Answer the questions, strike category circles, and become the first player to answer correctly to the last question to win the game.

66264.name: Lexico NL-UK
66264.description:
From the publisher:
Lexico is a game and a dictionary combined in a unique and fun way. Beside its excellent game value, it also has a huge educational value and is of interest to anyone who wants to learn languages. Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words from five different categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The words are divided into 3 difficulty levels and the idea is that every player plays the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills.

66266.name: Lexico LV-RU
66266.description:
From the publisher:
Lexico is a game and a dictionary combined in a unique and fun way. Beside its excellent game value, it also has a huge educational value and is of interest to anyone who wants to learn languages. Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words from five different categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The words are divided into 3 difficulty levels and the idea is that every player plays the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills.

66267.name: Lexico LV-ENG
66267.description:
From the publisher:
Lexico is a game and a dictionary combined in a unique and fun way. Beside its excellent game value, it also has a huge educational value and is of interest to anyone who wants to learn languages. Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words from five different categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The words are divided into 3 difficulty levels and the idea is that every player plays the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills.

66268.name: Lexico LT-ENG
66268.description:
From the publisher:
Lexico is a game and a dictionary combined in a unique and fun way. Beside its excellent game value, it also has a huge educational value and is of interest to anyone who wants to learn languages. Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words from five different categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The words are divided into 3 difficulty levels and the idea is that every player plays the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills.

66269.name: Lexico RUS-ENG
66269.description:
From the publisher:
Lexico is a game and a dictionary combined in a unique and fun way. Beside its excellent game value, it also has a huge educational value and is of interest to anyone who wants to learn languages. Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words from five different categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The words are divided into 3 difficulty levels and the idea is that every player plays the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills.

66271.name: Faqir
66271.description:
In Faqir players try to make specific patterns with nails (cones) that match with the pattern on a card they have drawn.
The first player to achieve this wins. Each card is partially visible to the other players; use this to spike the fakirs of your opponents!

Taken from the publisher website:

Everyone knows about the faqirs lying on beds of nails, but the ones in this game are not so keen on sharp things – they prefer to squirm between the nails! Who is the first player to place the nails so that their faqir dares to come out from his dressing room to perform? Faqir is a great game for the whole family – all you need is some perceptive skills, light strategic thinking and a pinch of luck!

66272.description: The famous Monopoly game. This edition has the theme Dordrecht, a dutch city. Try to get the streets of Dordrecht and build your houses and hotels.
66272.name: Monopoly: Dordrecht

66273.description: The famous Monopoly game. Try to sell and buy property in the Dutch city Enschede. Collect streets and build houses and hotels.
66273.name: Monopoly: Enschede

66274.name: Dragon Jewels
66274.description:
The players collect jewels from the dragon's cave and place them in their jewels box. The first player to collect 4 of each color (red, blue and yellow) wins. If the dragon catches the player he chases them to the exit.

The game uses a mechanic of common control where each player controls the dragon on their turn.

66276.description:
A simple educational card game for two players. Both players have a deck of 17 cards with different military ranks of Polish Army from 1939. Both players take three cards in their hands and secretly put one of them on table. The player who put a card with higher rank is able to take cards from the table and gain higher military rank. A goal is to become a marshal.

Third revised edition has been expanded to accommodate third player. This new (2017) edition also adds Military Police cards allowing the players to take one card already used back to the hand.
66276.name: Awans: Zostań Marszałkiem Polski

66277.name: Sync Up!
66277.description:
From the publisher's website:

Have you ever said "jinx!"?

USAOPOLY turns "jinx -- you owe me a soda" into Sync Up!, the hilarious new party game where players are paired up to try and say the same thing at the same time. With a variety of fun categories, only a few seconds to answer, and a different partner every round, each game’s a toss up of who’s going to Sync Up! the most to win.

To start, one player picks a card, reads the category and the first question followed by "Ready. Set. Sync Up!" (to give partners a quick moment to think.) So for example, the category is "pizza" and the question is a "a meat topping... Ready. Set. Sync Up!" Couples shout out their answers. If they both say "pepperoni" they move ahead 2 spaces on the game board. If one says "pepperoni" and the other says "sausage," they stay where they are on the board. At the end of each round, players switch partners and play a new card. To make the game more interactive and challenging, players can use Make A Bet Cards to score extra points by guessing how many times partners Sync Up! on each turn. First player to reach the Winner Circle wins the game.

66278.name: GamesMaster International (Issue 11 - June 1991)
66278.description:
From the Contents Page:

•MasterPlay: The force will be with you - if you play the Star Wars RPG
•MasterView: Crucial reviews of Blood!, solar Trader, the Rifts sourcebook and more
•HardWired: What's coming up soon in the computer RPG/Wargame scene
•MasterWorld News: All that's hot, some that's lukewarm
•MasterGame: A high-level political scenario for AD&D, GURPS and Runequest, "Storm Clouds over Kuznitsa"
•MasterView: Alan Crump gets between the covers
•MasterPiece: Part One of "Druss the legend", a short story by top author David Gemmell
•Beyond the Citadel: More new fantasy miniatures reviewed
•RuleMaster: Throught the myths of time, bring Celts into your fantasy gaming
•MasterWayne: First past the post in PBM
•MasterLive: The Alchemist p-p-p-picks up a pixie
•Tech Talk: Ashley Watkins traces the origins of Mech games
•MasterInfo: Coventions, Meets, Clubs and Contacts
•MasterMail: Air your grumbles or just tell us how good you think the magazine is ...
•Critical Mass: Thought for the day from David Langford

66279.name: Dark Millennium
66279.description:
From the book:

As Europe entered the 11th century, millennial fever became all too real. On the thousandth anniversary of the death of the Son, evil opened a doorway into the world, and all Hell literally broke loose.

The first seal in the Revelations of St. John has been broken, but not in the way people thought. The dead have risen, but they are hungry for the flesh of the living!

Worse, the Secret Revelations say that there is war in Heaven, and the outcome is not as certain as people tend to think...

Hell is on Earth, and Heaven is silent. Only miracles and acts of faith show that the Divine still smiles on your existence. Otherwise, the fate of humanity is in your hands.

Dark Millennium begins in the historical 11th century, but takes a sharp turn when the quasi-biblical End Times begin. Players will take the role of extraordinary individuals called upon to battle the undead menace, for Church, for King and for simple survival.

Dark Millennium includes character generation, cultural, religious, historical and geopolitical information on the 11th century, three short adventures, and rules for miracles, magic and other manifestations of the supernatural in this alternate historical setting.

66281.name: A Fatal Blow
66281.description:
Fatal Blow is a skirmish game of miniature combat between individual warriors, fighters and knights. Fatal Blow is designed to be a fast playing but intriguing game of battle between fantasy and medieval era warriors.
To most experienced miniature gamers, there is a lot about Fatal Blow that will be familiar, however whether your are an experienced miniature gamer or not you will find a lot about Fatal Blow to set it apart from other skirmish games in this setting. In Fatal Blow, BOTH the warrior and his weapon(s) will be crucial to his success or failure in any particular combat. In addition, no matter how powerful a character is, or how weak his opponent may be; if armed with the right weapon, the weaker opponent always has a chance of killing his powerful foe with a single, well laid blow.

66283.name: Toystore Chess
66283.description: Toystore Chess begins with an empty 5x5 board and a King, Queen, Rook, Bishop, and Knight in reserve for each player. Opponents alternate placing one piece at a time on any open square until all pieces are on the board. Play proceeds as Chess.

66284.name: State Capitals
66284.description:
Players will be able to correctly match the 50 states in the USA with their capitals.

Object of play is to form matched pairs of states and their capitals. When a player gets rid of all of his or her cards, that player wins the game.

Scoring: The winning player receives 5 points for each card remaining in the other players' hands, whether they form matched pairs or not. Each player, including the winner, receives 10 points for each correctly matched pair and loses 10 points for each incorrectly matched pair that he or she laid down during the game. A list of states and their capitals should be provided to assist players during scoring.

Components:
100 cards
50 states & 50 capitals

66285.name: States in Mind: Regional Rummy & State Line
66285.description:
The players(s) shall be able to recognize the various regions within the United States and group states accordingly.

Player in his turn asks any one participant for a card from a particular region. If the participant has a card from that region, that card is given to player. If not, player draws a card from the stock pile. If card drawn from stock pile is of the region requested, player may continue to call on individual participants for a specific region until players or pile do not respond with region requested.
Play continues to left. When player has a complete region, that region is placed in a stack on the table.
Game is won by player with no cards remaining in hand.

Components:
50 cards

66286.name: Hunt and Seek Through History
66286.description:
Find the greatest number of objects hidden in the game boards. In the “Time Challenge”, children are invited to locate eight objects used to measure time in each of the eras depicted on the game boards.

Bilingual (french / english). This game of observation develops a child’s visual acuity and concentration while providing an opportunity to learn a second language. Beautifully illustrated game boards allow children to explore prehistory, ancient Egypt, Grecian antiquity, the Middle Ages, the Far West, the pirate era, the discovery of America and, finally, a glimpse of the future.

Object of the game:
To locate illustrations in the game boards and collect as many cards as possible

Box contains:
4 game boards double sided
50 cards
Game rules

66287.name: Street Drug Rummy
66287.description:
Street Drug Rummy is intended to familiarize players with the common names and major classifications of illegal and abused drugs which are all too readily available on the streets today.

The object of the game is to group the cards with General Classification, Specific Drug Families, Way Administered or Sudden Death. Players can challenge another player on classifications, families, or sudden death combinations. The drug chart (last page) is used to judge the validity of the challenge.

Components:
54 cards

66288.name: Strike-a-Chord
66288.description:
The players will be able to organize keyboard musical-note representations into appropriate chord formations and state the name of the chord sequence correctly.

If the player has three or four cards forming a chord, the chord sequence is placed on the table. The player must then tell the other players the name of the chord. If correct, this player's turn continues by selecting another card as in step 2. If the player is incorrect, another player may "steal" the chord by stating the chord name correctly.
The winner is the player with the most chord formations.

Components:
46 cards

66290.name: Striking a Balance
66290.description:
Players will be able to analyze physical quantities into their fundamental units of measurement.

The object of Striking a Balance is to form balanced equations of physical units that appear in many physics formulas. Equations are formed with cards in various combinations, each card bearing a physical quantity which is broken down into its fundamental units. The winner of a round is the first person to "go out" as in Rummy, which means that the player can use all the cards in his/her hand to form complete equations. Points may be accumulated at the end of each round and the grand wazoo is the player who reaches 100 points first.

Components:
48 cards

66291.name: Suave Poker
66291.description:
The players will be able to identify the personal pronoun and verb tense of irregular Spanish verbs. This edition of the game includes only the present, imperfect, preterite, future and conditional tenses.

Gameplay is similar to poker. Combinations are with Spanish persons, tenses and verbs.

Components:
For twenty irregular verbs, there are a possible 500 cards.

66292.name: Subtraction Sentences
66292.description:
The players will be able to correctly complete subtraction sentences.

The object of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all of his/her cards. To do this, the players must use their cards to make subtraction sentences.
Player places in his turn either a number card, a minus card, an equals card, or a wild card with the face up card to create a subtraction sentence. A wild card can stand for any card the player wants.

Components:
75 cards

66294.name: Synonyms
66294.description:
The players will be able to increase their vocabulary.

The object of the game is to form sets of two or three cards which are synonyms.
The first player to go out (have no more cards in his hand) wins. If a time limit is set instead, the winner is the player with the most cards on the table at the end of the predetermined time period.

Components:
250 cards

66299.name: The Game of Hickory, Dickory, Dock
66299.description:
Information from gamearchives.org:

Each player selects a piece and begins the game either on the "Start Here" space or the "Or Here" space. Players take turns spinning the indicator and moving up as many places as the indicator shows. Players play in turn trying to reach the UPPER SPACE first. A player must reach the UPPER SPACE by exact count in order to win. "When the clock strikes 1" that is to say, when a player spins a 1, instead of moving forward one space his piece is immediately dropped to one of the spaces marked "Start Here" and the players piece is obliged to climb again. The only time a 1 does not cause a piece to return to the start space is if the piece is 1 spot away from winning and a 1 would be required to win the game. Then the 1 spin does indeed win the game.

66301.name: Roleplayer (Issue 16 - Oct 1989)
66301.description:
In This Issue

At Last ... Books and Bookstores!
Short Notes
GURPS Q&A
I'm Not Dead Yet! by John M. Ford
Errata
Spell Dependency Charts by Walter Milliken
37 Billion NPCs by Creede Lambard
Playing With a Full Deck by John J. Miller
New for GURPS
And In This Episode... by Brian J. Underhill
Coming Attractions

66302.name: Game of Robinson Crusoe
66302.description:
From Gamearchive.org.

The popular story of "Robinson Crusoe" forms the basis for this game for children. In the pack of cards, with which the game is played are several cards which have exact duplicates, but there is only one card each for Robinson Crusoe, Friday and Rescue Ship. The cards are dealt out one at a time and if the player has two cards that are the same kind, that is 2 Goats, Turtles, Cannibals etc. the player pairs them up and they are thrown out of the game. Then the start player begins by drawing randomly from the player to his left 1 card. If he pairs a card the pair is removed, Then the next player draws a card. Play continues this way until one player successfully gets the 3 cards CRUSOE,FRIDAY, and RESCUE in his hand whereby winning the game.

66305.name: The Lives of Sedenya
66305.description:
User Summary:
A small give-away from Greg Stafford for people who bought the Imperial Lunar Handbook 2 (Tentacles X Debut Edition) at the Tentacles Convention in 2006. It contains stories/records of the life of the Gloranthan Red Moon Goddess.

From the front cover: The troubles and victories of Our Wonderful Sedenya who is called the Red Lunar Goddess.

66306.name: GamesMaster International (Issue 12 - Jul 1991)
66306.description:
From the Contents Page:

•MasterPlay: Is it a bird?! Is it a plane?! Nah, it's someone wearing his boxers over his trousers. Which is a long-winded way of trailing our superhero RPGs overview
•HardWired: Jack-in to the latest computer RPGs
•MasterView: Roque Mistress, The Boy King, Hot Pursuit, Reich Star are among this month's review section
•MasterWorld News: Including the results of the first GMI Fantasy Awards
•MasterGame: Concluding our high-level political scenario, "Storm Clouds over Kuznitsa"
•MasterView: Our human word processor Alan Crump, picks up some new paperbacks
•MasterPiece: Part two of "Druss the legend", our exclusive adaptation of David Gemmell's short-ish story
•Soldiers of Fortune: Up to the minute miniatures reviews by any other name (RIP beyond the citadel) with Steve Blease
•RuleMaster: on the hiss with s-s-snakes
•MasterWayne: News and reviews from the PBM scene
•MasterLive: Hints and tips on how to write and design live adventures
•Tech Talk: Ashley Watkins takes a look at the "Big Four" Mecha RPGs
•Battlemaster: How to organise table-top mass battles for conventions plus the launch of our exciting battlemater competition
•Masterfile: Your complete guide to roleplaying events, big and small,plus our contacts network linking rolegames worldwide
•MasterMail: You have your say about our hobby
•Critical Mass: Our award-winning columnist wraps up our first birthday issue

66307.name: The Prisoner of Zenda
66307.description: In this game there is a board on which are illustrated the castle at Zenda and the palace at Streslau and numerous playing tracks representing the roads between them. There are 3 dice, 4 large pieces and 8 small green pieces who are soldiers. The large red piece represents the king who was the Prizoner of Zenda, 2 large yellow pieces represent Rudolph and Colonel Sapt and the large Green piece represents Black Michael. To win the Zenda player has to capture green pieces with his yellow pieces to open a hole in the green line through which his red piece may slip to Streslau and thus win the game. The Streslau player should try and stop all paths leading to his city by blockade at critical points.

66310.description: The game centers on a 3-D tree with a plastic trunk and cardboard leaves. Each player gets 3 monkeys in their color (there are 12 monkeys total plus one black chimpanzee figure). Players roll dice to have their monkeys climb the tree via holes in the trunk. If a double is thrown, the player must place the chimpanzee figure a number of holes. Any monkeys the chimpanzee passes must return to the bottom of the tree and start over. The first player to get three monkeys to the top of the tree wins.
66310.name: Monkey Shines

66312.description:
Champions of the Forgotten Realms is the eleventh Small Expansion Set (wave 11) in the HeroScape series. It is the first expansion (wave D1) for the Dungeon and Dragons crossover started by Heroscape Master Set: Battle for the Underdark. It is also fully compatible with all previously released Heroscape products.

There are 4 booster packs:

Heroes of Faerûn
Warriors of the Ghostlight Fen
Fury of the Primordials
Glaun Bog Raiders




Each pack contains 5 figures and a glyph.
66312.name: Heroscape Expansion Set D1: Champions of the Forgotten Realms

54361.name: Heroscape Master Set:  Battle for the Underdark

66313.name: City Ruins
66313.description:
From the publisher:

Every city has ruined buildings, and Dragonshire is no exception. From burned out roofs to almost completely demolished buildings, we've got your needs for destruction covered! This set includes a ruined roof, complete with interior detail, that can be added to any of the 4x5 buildings from the Dragonshire Deluxe Edition model set. A stand-alone ruined building corner, complete with second level and multiple texture options is also included. Add-on fire effects also enhance your Dragonshire city models as well. Finally, this set features our exclusive DRAGON LAYERS texture options that allow YOU to customize the artwork before printing the model out.

66315.description:
BOMP! Reach the center of the ring and Bomp out your opponents, with grace and precision!
Only one will survive, or maybe two, or maybe all of your three warriors, if you Bomp really well!

Bomp is a fast paced and interactive fingertip game, for 1,2,3,4 players (solo game is possible and useful to train your fingers) up to 8 players with the expansions you can choose with other 4 teams you like.

Realized with big and coloured 25 mm Spielmaterial wooden discs, the game was presented at Ideag 2010.

For any info-order feel free to contact the author
anporaz@libero.it
66315.name: BOMP

66316.name: Gamma World Roleplaying Game

rpghonor.20974: 2010 Origins Awards Best Roleplaying Game Nominee

66316.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A wacky, wily roleplaying game of post-apocalyptic peril.

Earth. After the apocalypse. Never mind the radiation—you’re gonna like it here.

The D&D Gamma World Roleplaying Game offers hours of rollicking entertainment in a savage land of adventure, where the survivors of some mythical future disaster must contend with radioactive wastes, ravaged cities, and rampant lawlessness. Against a nuclear backdrop, heroic scavengers search crumbled ruins for lost artifacts while battling mutants and other perils.

This product is a complete, stand-alone roleplaying game that uses the 4th Edition D&D Roleplaying Game system as its foundation. It appeals to D&D players as well as gamers interested in fantasy science fiction set in a bizarre, post-apocalyptic world.


160-page book with rules for character creation, game rules, and an adventure
2 sheets of die-cut character and monster tokens
2 double-sided battle maps
Cardstock character sheets and mutation power cards
Mutation power card deck
Loot power card deck

66317.name: Gamma World Expansion Pack: Famine in Far-go

rpghonor.13909: 2011 Golden Geek Best RPG Supplement Nominee

66317.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A new adventure and more monstrous mutants for your D&D Gamma World game!

The radioactive wastelands of Earth are home to many bizarre and barbaric creatures. The apocalypse hasn’t exactly made the world a better place. It’s survival of the fittest. Time to build a new food chain.

This game expansion presents a menagerie of mutant creatures and a ready-to-play adventure. The monsters presented herein can also be pulled over and used in the Dungeons & Dragons Fantasy Roleplaying Game.

This product includes:


160-page adventure book, including new mutant monsters
4 sheets of die-cut mutant monster tokens
A fold-out battle map

66318.name: Gamma World Expansion Pack: Legion of Gold
66318.description:
The radioactive wastelands of Earth are home to many bizarre and barbaric creatures. The apocalypse hasn’t exactly made the world a better place. It’s survival of the fittest. Time to build a new food chain.

This game expansion presents a menagerie of mutant creatures and a ready-to-play adventure. The monsters presented herein can also be pulled over and used in the Dungeons & Dragons Fantasy Roleplaying Game.

This product includes:


160-page adventure book, including new mutant monsters and
4 sheets of die-cut mutant monster tokens
A fold-out battle map

66320.name: Animal Hunt
66320.description: Along the lines of Scrutineyes and / or Where's Waldo. Search and find different animals on a colorful game board.

66321.name: Apollo Space Rocket Checkers
66321.description: A checkers varient with a spinner determining possible moves. The game board also dictates special or extra possible moves.

66322.name: Go! The Bahamas Game
66322.description: A track movement sailing adventure game. Basically roll and move with an unusual looking game board that has the instructions printed on it.

66323.name: Fight that Fire Game
66323.description:
Typical roll and move game on a very boring looking game board that is somewhat hard on the eyes.

Contents include: 32 Playing Cards, 4 Markers, 10 Fire Safety Tips Cards, 10 Chief's Orders & 1 Die.

66324.description:
Game about the short lived Saturday morning TV series. There was a band called the Guys Next Door (1 album released) and the TV show centered around a series of sketch comedy skits featuring the band. Basically, it was a failed attempt at capitalizing on the New Kids on the Block mania.

The game is a typical teen girl fantasy game about boys.

Contents include: 20 Personal Color Photos, Set of Dream Girl Fantasy Cards, Dream Girl Spinner, 4 Pawns & Photo Gameboard with BONUS autographed photo of Guys on the back.
66324.name: Guys Next Door

66325.name: Oh Magoo, You've Done it Again
66325.description:
A roll and move game with colorful 3D board elements. Instructions are printed on the board.

Contents include: 5 Player Pieces, 17 Playing Cards, 8 Card Buildings and Die.

66326.name: The Dresden Files Roleplaying Game, Volume 1: Your Story

rpghonor.9356: 2010 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Nominee

66326.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tell Us Your Story

Beneath the “normal” surface of the world are things and people which most of us don’t want to know about, and will do our best to forget about if we ever come near them. People won’t see what they don’t want to see.

But that’s most of us. And you—you’re not most of us.

What’s Your Story?

Whether you’re a champion of God, changeling, vampire, werewolf, wizard, or plain “vanilla” mortal human being, this volume of The Dresden Files RPG gives you all the rules you need to build characters and tell your own stories in the Dresdenverse. Inside, you’ll uncover the secrets of spellcasting, the extents of mortal and supernatural power, and the hidden occult reality of the unfamiliar city you call home.
Together with Volume Two: Our World, The Dresden Files RPG: Your Story gives you everything you need to make your own adventures in the thrilling and dangerous world of New York Times best-selling author Jim Butcher’s Dresden Files series!

rpgitemversion.339223: The Dreden Files Juego de Rol Libro 2: Nuestro Mundo

66327.name: The Dresden Files Roleplaying Game, Volume 2: Our World

rpghonor.9356: 2010 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Nominee

66327.description:
Step Into Our World

We are wizards, cops, mechanics, werewolves, doctors, fairies, mobsters, reporters, holy warriors, and vampires.

We call upon the dark powers of the Never never—or the darkness in human nature.

We are the monsters living next door or lurking behind a friendly face.

This is the Dresdenverse.

This is Our World.

This volume of The Dresden Files RPG gives you extensive detail on the factions, creatures, foes, and allies of the Dresdenverse. You’ll find over 200 creatures and characters complete with all the information you’ll need to bring them into your own game, as well as a detailed chapter on modern-day Occult Chicago by Kenneth Hite, and an original short story by Jim Butcher.
Together with Volume One: Your Story, The Dresden Files RPG: Our World gives you everything you need to make your own adventures in the thrilling and dangerous world of New York Times best-selling author Jim Butcher’s Dresden Files series!

66328.name: Roleplayer (Issue 17 - Nov 1989)
66328.description:

66329.name: Queah's game
66329.description:
A traditional game from Liberia. This game is played by Queah tribe. Game plays on a 5x5 checkered board. Each player has 10 piece in his own color. Game start with an initial start positon with 8 game piece in two different color on board.Pieces moves diagonally as checkers.

On each turn, each player may:
Move one stone to a diagonal adjacent empty cell.
Or, jump (diagonally) over an enemy stone landing on the immediate empty cell. The jumped stone is captured and the other player must place a piece to an empty cell of the board with same color with used cells of board. (if there are in staock). The players only use the squares of the same color).

The aim of this game is capturing all ennemy stones.

66330.description:

Big Bang is an open-ended series of reference books designed for avid players of roleplaying games, especially in the modern and near future genres. Each volume presents factual data and information on a number of weapons, including details of the weapon’s history, along with statistics allowing immediate use in a number game systems. The factual, real world data can be used to easily adapt the presented weapons to a wide range of game systems.

66332.name: Seegover
66332.description:
This game is played on an empty 5x5 square board. There are 24 white and 24 black game pieces. The game has two phase. Drop phase and move phase according to rules.The players try to capture, their opponent pieces.
DROP PHASE - In his turn, each player must place a game piace in his/her own color on an empty cell, except the central cell which should be empty until this first phase is over.
When 24 stones are dropped, the game continues with the move phase.

MOVE PHASE - At each turn, each player must do one of the following actions:
Move a friendly stone to an orthogonally adjacent empty cell.
There are custodian captures, i.e., every enemy stone between the moved stone and another friendly stone (over the same line) switches color.
After a move with results in a capture, the moved stone may optionally move again into its initial cell (which may result in more custodian captures).
If a player cannot move any stone, he should pick one of his/her game piece from any cell and place it on an empty cell, executing the eventual custodian captures.
The player who has only four stones or less, loses the game.

66335.name: Simultana
66335.description:
This game is played on a 5x5 board. Game starts with a setup position.
Each player moves one of his stones orthogonally respecting the following restriction:
The moved Black stone must create at least one adjacent area of 3 or 5 empty cells.
The moved White stone must create at least one adjacent area of 2 or 4 empty cells.
The aim of this game is trapping the opponent pieces.
The first player unable to make a move, loses.

66338.name: Tandems
66338.description:
This game is played on a 5x5 board. Game starts with an initial setup position. On each turn, each player must move two friendly stones to adjacent (diagonal or orthogonal) empty cells, both in the same direction. Stones cannot move into the restricted points on game board.

The player that first moves 5 stones to the last row wins the game.

The player who makes the last move, wins the game.

66343.name: Big Bang Volume 10: Small Arms from Ricochet

User summary

66344.name: Vanakriget
66344.description:
This game is played on a 5x5 square board. Players start to game with a initial setup position. Each player has 7 game piece in his/her own color.
On each turn, each player must do one of the following things:
Capture a stone on a (orthogonal or diagonal) forward direction by jumping over it and landing on the immediate empty cell. Captures are multiple and mandatory.
Drop a captured friendly stone on any empty cell.
Move a stone on a (orthogonal or diagonal) forward direction to an empty cell.
The player that moves his all game pieces to the opponent's setup position wins the game.

66345.name: Big Bang: Mini-Bang 1 – Extra Material from 2003
66345.description:
User summary

Mini-Bang supplements are additions to the Big Bang series that require one of the normal Big Bang volumes as a rules reference.

This volume contains statistics and descriptions for the following firearms:


Beretta CX4 Storm Carbine
Colt Lawman Mk. 3 "Air Crew" Revolver
Companion Flashlight Firearm
Fara 83 Assault Rifle
H&K VP-70
Roth-Steyr Repetierpistole Modell 1907
XM-148 Grenade Launcher

66346.name: Big Bang: Mini-Bang 2 – Deadliest Weapon Than Never Was
66346.description:
From the back of the book

Big Bang is an open-ended series of reference books designed for avid players of roleplaying games, especially in the modern and near future genres. Each volume presents factual data and information on a number of weapons, including details of the weapon’s history, along with statistics allowing immediate use in a number game systems. The factual, real world data can be used to easily adapt the presented weapons to a wide range of game systems.


User summary

Mini-Bang 2 contains rules and descriptions for the various incarnations of the Special Purpose Infantry Weapon, none of which ever saw production.

66347.name: Big Bang: Mini-Bang 3 – Experimental Weapons
66347.description:

Big Bang is an open-ended series of reference books designed for avid players of roleplaying games, especially in the modern and near future genres. 66348.name: Vector Powers
66348.description:
This game was presented at 100 Strategic Games for Pen and Paper by Walter Joris. The game is played on a 4x4 board. Each player has 4 game piece in his/her own color.
At the begining of the game each player alternately, place eight friendly stones each.
During just four turns, each player shifts one row left/right, one column up/down or one of the two main diagonals, just by one cell.
Every stone pushed out the board is removed from play.
After those four turns (i.e., eight shifts), The player with more stones on board wins the game (or a draw if equal).

66349.name: Big Bang: Mini-Bang 4 – CAWS & Automatic Shotguns
66349.description:
From the back of the book

Big Bang is an open-ended series of reference books designed for avid players of roleplaying games, especially in the modern and near future genres. 66350.name: Vilbergen
66350.description:
This game is played on a 3x4 rectangular board. Each player has 5 pieces in his/her own color.
At the begining of the game each player alternately place a stone into an empty cell exept one restricted cell.
After all cells occupied, On each turn, each player must do one of the following actions:
Capture an adjacent stone on an orthogonal direction by jumping over it and landing on the immediate empty cell. Captures are multiple and mandatory or move a piece on an orthogonal direction to an empty cell.
The player that captures all enemy stones, or has his last stone on the restricted cell wins the game.

66351.name: Wali
66351.description:
This is a traditional game played on a 5x6 rectangular board. Each player has 12 game piece in his own color.
At the beginin in each turn, each player places a stone from the reserve to any empty space on the board which is not adjacent (orthogonal) to a friendly stone. If a player cannot drop more stones, he must pass. This continues until all stones are placed on the board, or no more stones can be placed.
After that,in each turn, each player moves a stone to an empty adjacent (orthogonal) cell. If he is able to make 3 in a rows (not more or less) he may capture one enemy stone. It's not clear that diagonal 3 in-a-row is allowed
The player who capture all of his opponents stones wins the game
