66352.description:
User summary

Small Arms of Argentina presents rules, descriptions and statistics for modern firearms produced in Argentina. This volume of the Big Bang series supports different RPG systems than the previous books. The game statistics are presented in four different appendices, one for each game.

66353.name: Chicken Roundabout
66353.description:
Chicken Roundabout is a board game inspired by the 'Chicken Roundabout' in in Ditchingham, near Bungay (Suffolk, UK) a roundabout (traffic circle) famous for the chickens which can always be seen there.

The game is basically an enhanced version of Pachisi/Ludo, with the addition of 'tokens' required to get the chickens home. In this version, opponents' chickens can not be sent back to the start by overtaking them.

The game was previously marketed as 'Us Chickens'. The new version differs by having local businesses featured on the spaces on the board.

66354.name: Twister Moves: Hannah Montana Edition
66354.description:
From the publisher:
Dance along to Hannah Montana's awesome songs! This cool Twister Moves game allows you to listen to her music and move as the DJ tells you to! Put the CD in your machine, set out the mats and away you go! Listen carefully to the instructions and follow the fun moves! If you're the only one to get the moves right, you win! Practice on your own and then compete against friends! A wonderful way to encourage active play! Great for any Hannah Montana fan!

80591.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game – Gray Hag Promo

boardgameintegration.59946: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game

boardgamehonor.13905: 2011 Golden Geek Best Thematic Board Game Nominee

66356.description:
From Wizards of the Coast website:

A cooperative game of adventure for 1-5 players set in the world of Dungeons & Dragons.

A heavy shadow falls across the land, cast by a dark spire that belches smoke and oozes fiery lava. A cave mouth leads to a maze of tunnels and chambers, and deep within this monster-infested labyrinth lurks the most terrifying creature of all: a red dragon!

Designed for 1-5 players, this boardgame features multiple scenarios, challenging quests, and cooperative game play.

Each player selects a hero; a rogue, thief, warrior, cleric, or wizard. On their turn, each player can explore further into the dungeon (turn over new tiles), move through the already explored parts of the dungeon, and fight monsters. When a new dungeon tile is revealed, there is typically an encounter of some sort, and new monsters to fight are added. Slain monsters reward the players with treasure, and experience points, allowing them to level up and increase their skills during play. Players must cooperate to stay alive, slay the monsters, and achieve the goal of their quest. Each scenario has a different goal - from retrieving a relic, to slaying a vampire lord.
66356.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Board Game

66358.name: BrainBox: Manchester United Game
66358.description:
From the publisher:
Manufacturer's Description
BrainBox Manchester United is a game for the whole family. The game is ingeniously simple. A player has ten seconds to study a card that shows players past and present in action and is then asked a question about the card, chosen by the roll of a die. If the card is answered correctly the card is kept, if not it is returned to the box. The most cards held after ten minutes decides the winner. Cards are real photos of players, with extra information like how many caps the player has, the year of their International debut and what shirt number they wear. Hard core fans can put their knowledge to the test--especially if their powers of observation let them down. The game is presented in a smart cube box and is a perfect gift for Man U fans who already have everything.

66359.description:
From the publisher:
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes. The first player takes a card from the BrainBox and turns the timer over. The player then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player two and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player two checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to player one to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the BrainBox and the next player chooses a card. Please remember, the answer to the question is on the picture side of the card, so look carefully! The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins! If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins! For 1 or more players, ages 8+. Contains 54 illustrated cards, 1 rules card, 1 timer and 1 eight sided die. Have fun!

Box Contains

54 picture/question cards
1 rules card
1 sand timer
1 eight-sided die
66359.name: BrainBox: Maths

66360.name: BrainBox: Football
66360.description:
From the publisher:
What can you spot in ten seconds? Turn the timer over and try and memorize as many pictures and words as you can. After ten seconds, pass the card to another player who asks a quick-fire question. Seems easy - cards include the following clubs - Arsenal, Aston Villa, Barnsley, Birmingham City, Blackburn Rovers, Blackpool, Bolton Wanderers, Bradford City, Brentford, Brighton & Hove Albion, Bristol City, Bristol Rovers, Burnley, Cardiff City, Carlisle United, Charlton Athletic, Chelsea, Chesterfield, Colchester United, Coventry City, Crystal Palace, Derby County, Doncaster Rovers, Everton, Fulham, Gillingham, Grimsby Town, Huddersfield Town, Hull City, Ipswich Town, Leeds United, Leicester City, Leyton Orient, Liverpool, Luton Town, Manchester City, Manchester United, Middlesbrough, Millwall, Newcastle United, Northampton Town, Norwich City, Nottingham Forest, Notts County, Oldham Athletic, Peterborough, Plymouth Argyle, Portsmouth, Port Vale, Preston North End, Queens Park Rangers, Reading, Scunthorpe, Sheffield United, Sheffield Wednesday, Southampton, Southend United, Stoke City, Sunderland, Swansea City, Swindon Town, Tottenham Hotspur, Tranmere Rovers, Walsall, Watford, West Bromwich Albion, West Ham United, Wigan Athletic, Wolverhampton Wanderers, Wycombe Wanderers, Yeovil

BrainBox Football Kids GamesPlayers will have 10 seconds to study a card before being asked a question from the back, chosen by the roll of the die. If the question is answered correctly the card is kept, if not it is returned to the box. The player with the most cards after 10 minutes wins the game!BrainBox Football Kids Games is a brilliant memory recall game that lasts just 10 minutes with rounds of ten seconds. Club history, famous players, fun facts and more! Features 71 football clubs from the Premiership, Championship and Leagues 1 and 2.

66361.description:
From the publisher:
What can you spot in ten seconds? Turn the timer over and try and memorise as many pictures and words as you can. After ten seconds, pass the card to another player who asks a quick-fire question.

History How many things can you spot in ten seconds? Turn the timer over and try to memorise as many of the pictures and words appearing on the beautifully-illustrated cards. After ten seconds, turn the card over, roll the die and answer a quick-fire question to win the card. The player with the most cards after 10 minutes wins. A fun way to learn history, from Stonehenge to the Channel Tunnel. Age 8 and above.
66361.name: BrainBox: History

boardgamehonor.12826: 2010 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee

66362.description:
Each player represents the leadership of a 17th century Scottish clan looking to expand its territory and its wealth. The success of your clan depends on your ability to make the correct decision at the opportune time, be it by establishing a new pasture for your livestock, growing grain for the production of whisky, selling your goods on the various markets, or investing in the cultivation of special places such as lochs and castles.

Glen More offers a unique turn mechanism. Players take territory tiles from a rondel. Picking a tile has not only influence on the actions you get by the surrounding tiles in your territory, it also determines when you'll have your next turn (and how many turns you will have in the game). But having a lot of turns is not always the best strategy for a successful chieftain.

Glen More is 6 in the Alea medium box series, and is rated a 4 on the alea complexity level.
66362.name: Glen More

66363.description:
From the publisher:
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes. The first player takes a card from the BrainBox and turns the timer over. The player then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player two and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player two checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to player one to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the BrainBox and the next player chooses a card. Please remember, the answer to the question is on the picture side of the card, so look carefully! The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins! If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins! For 1 or more players, ages 8+. Contains 54 illustrated cards, 1 rules card, 1 timer and 1 eight sided die. Have fun!

Box Contains

54 picture/question cards
1 rules card
1 sand timer
1 eight-sided die

The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes. The first player takes a card from the Brainbox and turns the timer over. The player then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player two and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player Two checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to Player One to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the Brainbox and the next player chooses a card. Please remember, the answer to the question is on the picture side of the card, so look carefully! The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins! If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins! For 1 player Look at the card as above for ten seconds. Then turn the card over and answer all the questions (use a pen and paper to record the answers). If all questions are answered correctly the card is kept. If any answers are incorrect, the card has to be put back in the Brainbox. See how many cards you have after five or ten minutes.
66364.name: Brainbox: My First ABC

66365.description:
From the publisher:
The object of this game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes.

The first player takes a card from the BrainBox and turns the timer over. The payer then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player 2 and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player 2 checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to player 1 to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the BrainBox and the next player chooses a card. The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins. If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins.

For 1 or more players, and ages 8+.

Kings and Queens How many things can you spot in ten seconds? Turn the timer over and try to memorise as many of the pictures and words appearing on the beautifully-illustrated cards. After ten seconds, turn the card over, roll the die and answer a quick-fire question to win the card. The player with the most cards after 10 minutes wins. A fun way to learn about our kings and queens of the realm. Age 8 and above.
66365.name: BrainBox: Kings & Queens Of England

66366.description:
Did you know that Vincent van Gogh painted over 900 paintings in his lifetime? And can you name the artist of Britain’s greatest painting? Developed in conjunction with London’s National Gallery, BrainBox Art is full of interesting facts and amazing images of some of the best paintings in the world in stunning high quality on 56 beautifully-illustrated cards.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

This simple concept can be played by all ages and in large groups as well as a 1 person game. Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material and designed in the UK, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun. Find out who the BrainBox is in your family – it may not be who you think it is!

Players 1 or more,
Ages 8 to 88,
Contains 56 illustrated cards, 1 rules card, 1 timer and 1 eight-sided die,
66366.name: BrainBox: Art

66367.description:
From the publisher:
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes. The first player takes a card from the BrainBox and turns the timer over. The player then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player two and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player two checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to player one to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the BrainBox and the next player chooses a card. Please remember, the answer to the question is on the picture side of the card, so look carefully! The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins! If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins! For 1 or more players, ages 8+. Contains 54 illustrated cards, 1 rules card, 1 timer and 1 eight sided die. Have fun!

Includes all 44 Presidents from Washigton to Lincoln, JFK to Obama. Can we do this...Yes we can!
66367.name: BrainBox: U.S. Presidents

66369.description:
From the back of the book

Big Bang is an open-ended series of reference books designed for avid players of roleplaying games, especially in the modern and near future genres. Each volume presents factual data and information on a number of weapons, including details of the weapon’s history, along with statistics allowing immediate use in a number game systems. The factual, real world data can be used to easily adapt the presented weapons to a wide range of game systems.


User summary

Big Bang Special Edition: War in Iraq contains new rules for anti-aircarft and anti-armor weaponry and biochemical weapons. The descriptions and statistics for the following weapons make up the main part:


Al-Quds Machine Rifle
Enfield SA-80 / L-85
Euromissile Milan

RPK
RPK-74
SA-7 Grail / 9K32M Strela-2M
SA-14 Gremlin / 9K34 Strela-3
SMAW
Tabul Assault Rifle

66370.name: Green Blood
66370.description:
Book 1 in the Virtual Reality series.

Back of the book:
The evil Westerman are destroying the once beautiful and idyllic Forest of Arden. The trees are being torn down and used to fuel the raging smelters that are making deadly weapons and engines of war. In your desperate quest to prevent the annihilation of the forest you must face many dangers. But will you be able to stop the heartless mercenaries and their Infernal Machine as it smashes the very heart of the forest, the Tree of Life?

66371.name: Heart of Ice
66371.description:
From the back of the book:
"In the twenty-third century the world is dying. The ice tightens in inexorable grip on the planet, squeezing the life out of its remaining inhabitants.

The source of this slow death is Gaia, the supercomputer designed to regulate the Earth's weather patterns. But Gaia is mad. The last glimmer of hope lies in the Heart of Volent, a mysterious meteorite which has already brought mutation and chaos to the globe. Can the Heart repair the damage and make of its wielder a new saviour?

The power to reshape reality is a tempting prize. The greatest heroes of the Age want the Heart, and the race is on to the abandoned city of Du-En, in the midst of the Saharan snow-wastes.

You will need all your resourcefulness to make the right alliances, outwit your opponents and attain the Heart. And then...?"

66372.description:
Loups gris en Atlantique (Grey wolves in Atlantic) is a single player game which simulates German patrols of a U-boot during WWII.

The player is a U-boot commander and his mission is to sink a maximum of allies boats during the beginning of 1941.
He has choice between 4 types of submarines (VII, IX.B, IX.C, IX.D2) with their own specificities and he can personnalize his character and crew with points.

Rules are easy and, like many solitaire games, needs a lot of dice rolls.
66372.name: Loups gris en Atlantique

66373.name: Wyx
66373.description:
Wyx is a 2 to 4 player game where each player control an ant queen on a 8 by 8 squares board.
After each move the queen lay an ant egg, althoug on some square she may lay more than one.
The moves are done by chosing from 4 columns of dominos, the top of each column being visble. Each dominos have a vertical and horizontal values indicating the move the queen will have to execute.

The aim of the game is to be the first player to lay out its 16 eggs.

66376.name: Mayhem Bank
66376.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In these uncertain financial times, it's good to know where your money can be protected. And if you find out, let us know! In the meantime, Mayhem Bank is happy to take your money off your hands! Don’t stand for it! Mayhem Criminals unite! Mayhem Superheroes foil their plans!!! This is your chance to play out all those bank-centric scenarios you’ve always dreamed of!

Mayhem Bank contains the following:

* "Lit" and "unlit" Marble floors in 1" and 1.5" formats
* Brown Carpet in gridless, 1" and 1.5" formats
* Grey Carpet in gridless, 1" and 1.5" formats
* Concrete groundtiles in 1" and 1.5" formats
* Alternate Brick groundtiles in gridless, 1" and 1.5" formats
* Two roof textures in gridless, 1" and 1.5" formats
* Exterior walls in 3" and 6" heights
* Purple interior walls in 3" and 6" heights
* Green interior walls in 3" and 6" heights
* Vault interior walls in 3" and 6" heights
* Pediment and columns
* Brick and concrete fences and fenceposts
* Lanterns
* Benches
* Lion statues
* ABMs (for three banks)
* Interior columns
* Wickets
* Fuzzy ropes!
* Cheque desks
* Gold and Silver bars
* Boxes o' cash
* Classic safe
* Safe-deposit boxes and lockers
* Signs, clocks, paintings, charts and cameras
* Office desks, chairs and bookshelves
* Typewriters, computers and FAX machines
* Big, honkin' vault door
* Armored van
* Four modern cars and taxis
* Three classic cars and taxi
* And as always, fully photographed instructions to take you through the build process.

So what are you waiting for? The heist is on!!!

66377.name: Mayhem JunkYard
66377.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Even in a town as tough as Mayhem, there's a place that's generally avoided. That place would be the junkyards down on the south side. Occaisionally a stretch limo makes it's way down there and the crushers come on late at night. They say the screaming sound is just metal fracturing. Suuure it is. On the other hand, if you had something worth hiding, there could be no better place...

So whether your players are enterprising businessmen trying to tie up "loose ends", a gang of no-goodniks looking for a place to give johnny law the slip or god-like heros looking for a quiet place to go mono-y-mono with their own "bad selves", Mayhem Junkyard is the place to be!

Mayhem Junkyard contains the following:

* 13 groundtiles in 1", 1.5" and gridless format
* Optional drainage ditches
* 13 unique 3" high walls for both office and garage
* Two-part gravel roof in 1", 1.5" and gridless format
* Office floor in 1", 1.5" and gridless format
* Garage floor in 1", 1.5" and gridless format
* Swing gate
* 2" high corrugated metal fence in four styles
* Two tow trucks
* Two antique trucks
* Crane with claw or bucket options
* Car crusher
* Single, double and quadruple stacked crushed cars
* Crushed metal cubes
* Oil drums
* Tire stacks
* Tire pile
* Two dog houses
* Tool shed
* Portable toilets
* Spotlit sign post with two signs
* Office desk
* Office chair
* Laptop
* Lockers
* Workbench
* File cabinet
* Supply shelf
* And as always, fully photographed instructions to take you through the build process.

So what are you waiting for? Summon your inner junkyard warrior!

66379.name: Mayhem Marina
66379.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Mayhem Marina is a modern day setting dockyard. It features modular docks in various sizes, a tug/fishing boat and a variety of props. It's great for nocturnal criminal activities, and with 184 pieces, there's always action and danger at Mayhem Marina!

Mayhem Marina includes the following items:

Modular Docks
* 3 8"x2" Docks
* 1 4"x2" Dock
* 1 4"x"1 Dock
* 1 3"x6" Dock
Tugboat/Fishing Boat in Two Hull Sizes
* Finely Detailed Cabin With Full Interior
* Upper Deck Steering Station
* Galley, Fridge
* Spotlight
* Radar
* Mast and Crane
* Control Console, Ship's Wheel
* Winch
* Opening Door
* Optional Railings
* Optional Ship Names
* Optional Control Panels
* Optional Wood or Grey Painted Deck
* Optional Tires
* Templates for Adding Foamcore Bases
* 1/2" and 1/4" High 1"x1" and 1"x2" Hatchways
* 1x1 Deck Vent
* 1X2 Tall Deckhouse
Platforms
* 1" High and 2" High
* 1" Step
* 4"x2"x1" Box Platform
* 4" Railings X 2
* 4"x1"x1" Inch Ramp
* 3"x6" Platform
Props
* Skiff with Outboard Motor
* Pilings in Wood and Metal
* Piling Boxes
* Short Pilings
* 12 Marina Signs with Base
* 2 Fuel Dock Gas Pumps
* Fuel Dock Shack with Counter
* Lamppost with Optional Fire Extinguisher Box
* 2 Trash Bins
* Electrical Transformer Box
* Shore Power unit
* Old-Style Lobster Traps
* Stack of Newer Lobster Traps
* Dockside Crane with Control Box
* Buoy
* "Catch of the Day" with Optional Monster
* Handcart
Ground Tiles

* 7"x7" Water X 1
* 7"x7" Wooden Dock
* 8"x2" Shoreline Adapter
* Edging
For Kitbashers
* Generic 7"x2" Boat Corridor
* 5" Ship Interior Bulkhead
* 5" Ship Exterior Bulkhead

66380.name: Mayhem MegaMall
66380.description:
Publisher Blurb:

NOW OPEN! Mayhem Cities very own MegaMall!

Plenty of free parking! Phase One is being swept by surly workers as we prepare for opening day! Air-conditioned comfort awaits for all your consuming needs. Drop the kids off and prepare to spend, spend, spend like it's 2002! Apocalyptic zombie infestation? No problem! Mayhem MegaMall is the perfect stronghold to fend off the flesh eating hordes while enjoying every modern convenience!

Mayhem Mega Mall is a modular way to build a multi-level shopping center. Using WorldWorks “Footprint method” builders can create a mall of any size and layout. This initial release includes three full stores, a plethora of mall floor tiles, and tons of props (Approx 190 pieces). Stores come with 6 and 9 inch wall lengths and floors for zero grid, 1" and 1.5" gaming scales. Additional stores and mall features are planned in upcoming expansions! Join us in the WorldWorksGames forums and get in on the vote! Have a store you want featured in a future expansion? Let us hear about it!

Mayhem MegaMall Includes all of the following:

* Manuel's For Men : Manuel sells only the finest shiny suits and parachute pants. Come for fashion, stay for Manuel!
* Athena's Pets : See fish, gerbils and friendly birds at Athena's Pets! If you need a way to turn love into poop, we've got it!!
* Code Black Records : Our snarling, buzz-cut clerks will sell you media...with attitude.
* Food Court /Crazy Vanka's Donair Yurt: Swept weekly for your tasty flavour feeling. You like!! Our new seating will have you saying, "I can't believe it's not plastic".
* Kiosk : From lottery tickets to phones and smokes, we've got you standing in line.
* Bloody and clean prop versions!!!
* Trees and Folaige
* Shopping Cart
* Cleaning Cart
* Mall Sink
* Escalator
* Stairs
* Gates and a Bridge
* Photo Booth
* ATM
* Pay Phone
* Lamps
* Planters and Fountains
* Trash Cans
* Benches
* Mayhem Mega Mall billboard for Streets of Mayhem
* Roof tiles with props ...AND MORE!!!

See you soon in Mayhem Mega Mall...The Dead Center Of Town!

66381.name: Mayhem Police Department
66381.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Citizens of Mayhem rejoice! Mayhem Police Department is here to save the day!

Mayhem is as tough as a city gets and it's only thanks to the dedicated men and women of the Mayhem Police Department that it doesn't simply implode! From petty street punks to maniacal supervillans and even zombies, if you do the crime in Mayhem, you better believe you're gonna do the time! Whether it's patrolling the streets on bikes, surveying in the chopper or bringing down the hammer with the SWAT team, MPD has the tools to get the job done!

Utilizing the highly successful "footprint" basing system, Mayhem Police Department brings you everything you need to create anything for a small county sheriff's office to a complete cell block and everything in between, even ordinary office buildings! Jam-packed with props and add-ons, almost any modern theme can be expressed and all provided in gridless, 1" and 1.5" format! MPD also features a fleet of police hardware from ubiquitous cruisers to armoured SWAT vehicles, even a helicopter!
Mayhem PD includes the following:

STRUCTURES
* Two Groundtiles
* Three unique interiors and two levels of exteriors in multiple versions
* Unique entrance and two-way mirror walls
* Four different floor types
* Rooftiles and helipad
PROPS
* A multitude of flat add-ons
* A variety of chairs
* Conference tables
* Work desks
* Cubicle walls
* Computers and Monitors
* Fax machines and Photocopiers
* Filing cabinets
* Water cooler
* Bookshelf
* Cupboards
* Lectern
* Mobile whiteboard
* Angled stairs
* Chief's desk
* Reception desk
* Reception benches
* Coffee machine
* Cell bunk, toilet and sink
* Lockers
* SWAT cabinet
* Palm-access gun container
* 3D Entrance
* Rooftop door access
* Rooftop A/C filters
* Searchlights
* Radio tower
VEHICLES
* Four different police cruisers
* Police Wagon
* Police motorcycles
* Armoured SWAT vehicle
* Police helicopter
* And as always this product comes with fully detailed step-by-step photographed instructions to guide you through the building process

What are you waiting for??? Your city of Mayhem needs protection, units need backing up and criminals need to be put in their place!

66382.name: UrbanMayhem: Bits of Mayhem Downtown
66382.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Bits of Mayhem: Downtown

Matt Lyon does it again with another incredible expansion to the city of Mayhem. This time we go Downtown and add another booster shot to our extremely popular 'Bits of Mayhem' model set. Let the combat spill over into the business district of Mayhem with these amazing new "HollyWood Flats" style buildings. These models are built with speed in mind allowing you to quickly fill a table with buildings in no time flat! Extend the scope, scale and richness of your city layout with this much needed downtown building set. Mix and match elements to create incredible new buildings of varying size. Slap on a slew of new doors and signs to get those strategic entry points right where you need them!

'Bits of Mayhem: Downtown' includes all of the following:

* Beige Brick Flats (x1)
* Office Block Flats (x2)
* Stucco/Brick Flats (x2)
* Skyscraper Flats (x4)
* Piped Roof (3 format)
* Universal Roof edgers
* Add-on Doors
* Add-on Business Signs
* BONUS: Movement guide for 1.5" players

66383.name: UrbanMayhem: Bits of Mayhem
66383.description:
Publisher Blurb:

WorldWorks model creator Matt Lyon does it again with his next incredible installment in the Urban Mayhem series. Bits of Mayhem blows the doors off with a massive assortment of props to fill your city streets. From cars, buses, trucks and semi’s to the vending machines, ATMs, benches, gas stations and phone booths this set has it all. To further add dimension to your city design we’ve even included a bonus building with a users KitBash guide to design new building types. And to further extend the scope of your city streets there are new ground tiles included in this set! Oh I almost forgot to mention the basket ball court, chain link fences and fire markers … and the destroyed vehicles … and the dumpsters … and the barrels … and … it just goes on and on.

Bits of Mayhem includes all of the following:

Vehicles

* Sports Car (x4 colours)
* Van (x4 colours)
* Burnt out car (x2 colours)
* City Bus
* Garbage Truck
* Flatbed Truck

Props

* Phone Booth
* Fire hydrants
* Parking meters
* Vending Machines
* New Billboards
* Fire escape & ladders
* Phone Stand
* Garbage Cans
* Dumpster
* Mailbox
* Newspaper dispensers
* Bus Shelter
* Bus bench
* Street Signs (rd, Ave, St, etc)
* Chain link Fence (print and transparent)
* Plant box
* Litter bins (city park type)
* Oil drums (singles and 3-in-1)
* Concrete stands
* Fires (print and transparent)
* Neon Signs (Hotel, Restaurant, Oriental tavern)
* Basketball nets

Gas stations (2)

* Ground tile
* Price board
* Pumps
* Paystation
* Overhang
* Concrete bumper
* Support posts (x2)
* Propane tower

New Tiles

* Weathered concrete
* Grass and gravel

Plus, "Hollywood Flat" style building for quick-n-dirty scenery

66384.name: Mayhem Industrial
66384.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The blast of horns from a big rig greets you as you pull up to the latest addition to the Mayhem landscape: Mayhem Industrial! Build that sprawling warehouse complex your players have been dreaming of! Mix 'n' match interiors with exteriors! Fight it out amongst pallets, barrels and iron girders! Stack shelves full of mystery-packed crates! Burst into the foreman's office and present him with a strongly worded letter about excessive overtime! Or just goof off with the fork lift. What are they going to do, fire you? HA! This is a union job!
Mayhem Industrial Includes all of the Following:

* 3 square cab and 3 long cab big rigs
* 3 cargo containers and a full size flatbed
* 3 types of quad barrels
* 6 pallets
* 3 cargo crates with 12 different contents for tactical objective gameplay!
* Iron girders
* Support column
* 7 different business signs to fill our your industrial district
* New roof and Floor textures
* Roof vents
* Foreman's office with filecabinet, desk and chairs
* Metal Stairs fully compatible with 1 & 1.5-inch based minis.
* And what warehouse would be complete without a forklift!
* Full color photographed instructions for all models
* Online video tutorials
* User support and established community at the WorldWorks games message board

66385.name: UrbanMayhem: Mayhem Armoury
66385.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Mayhem Armoury is the perfect way to start moving your games from the Streets of Mayhem into the heart of the city. The gritty, grimy inner-city lifestyle comes to you in cardstock form thanks to WorldWorks' renowned, high quality, hand-crafted textured artwork. Whether it's a bungalow, standing garage, small gunshop, or sprawling warehouse of weapons, Mayhem Armoury fits the bill!

With its modular design you can create multiple layouts on multiple floors and swap them easily thanks to an all new stacking system. As has become tradition, WorldWorks has included dozens of highly detailed props to enhance your gaming experience. Fully compatible with 1", 1.5" and gridless gaming formats, there's something for everyone in here.

Beginner or expert, it's no problem as the detailed, fully photographed step-by-step instructions walk you through the process from start to finish. But if you do get stuck, just log into WorldWorks community forum and pick the brains of fellow fanatics, or even ask the WorldWorks crew! So watch your step and come on in, because the Armoury is open for business!

Mayhem Armoury includes all of the following:

* Apartment with 6 wall options
* Gun shop with 6 wall options
* Garage with 6 wall options
* Optional interior wall for apartment
* 1", 1.5" and gridless floor options for each building
* 1", 1.5" and gridless roof and patio
* Patio railings
* Concrete roof liners
* 2 pistol cases
* Slanted ammo stand
* Payment desk
* Interior stairs
* Sofa
* Kitchen sink (yes, really!)
* Fridge
* TV
* A/C
* Rooftop air filter
* Worktable
* 2 tool cabinets
* Exterior ladders
* Patio umbrella
* Picnic table and benches
* 5 pick-up trucks
* Store and Patio awnings
* Store signs for Armoury and it's competitors
* Billboards and blank store signs
* Driveway and staircase overlays
* Optional transparencies for all windows

66386.description:

66389.name: GURPS Spaceships 5
66389.description:
Subtitled: Exploration and Colony Spacecraft

From the Publisher's Website:
"Explore Uncharted Stars!

"With these vessels of metal and plastic and a crew of hearty souls, ancient dreams of roaming the cosmos can be made real!

"GURPS Spaceships 5: Exploration and Colony Spacecraft is a toolkit that gives GMs the ships and game mechanics needed for campaigns focusing on deep-space exploration. It includes GURPS Spaceships statistics and descriptions for dozens of exploration and colony vessels, from near-future interplanetary rockets to giant interstellar generation ships.

"It also provides basic rules for survey and first-contact expeditions, plus simple systems for handling the hazards of long voyages through deep space, such as cosmic rays and solar flares.

"This is the fifth volume in the GURPS Spaceships series by David Pulver (co-author of GURPS Fourth Edition). It requires only the GURPS Basic Set and GURPS Spaceships. GURPS Space is highly recommended for its guidelines on running space campaigns and creating worlds and systems to explore and colonize."

66390.name: Roleplayer (Issue 26 - Oct 1991)
66390.description:
In This Issue

(Universal — and International, Too by Steve Jackson)
Letters
(Short Notes)
Ice Age Stalker by Andrea Sfiligoi
The Gift of Tongues by Steffan O'Sullivan
New for GURPS
Errata
GURPS Q&A
Building a Better 'Borg by C.J. Carella
A Whole New World by Michael Cule
Make Your Best Better by J.C. Connors and Brian McAuliffe
The Snagger by Charles Oines
Do You Want To Live Forever? by Henrik Martensson
Primary Sources by Ben Iglauer
Coming Attractions

66391.name: GURPS Spaceships 6
66391.description:
Subtitled: Mining and Industrial Spacecraft

From Publisher's Website:

"There's Gold in Them Thar Moons!

"GURPS Spaceships 6: Mining and Industrial Spacecraft equips you to exploit the not-so-empty void for commercial gain. It includes 29 ready-to-use vessels, from orbital factories, mining platforms, and shipyards . . . through salvage spacecraft, tugs, and tankers . . . to the TL12^ Leviathan-class constructor, for those times when you just have to demolish a planet to make way for a hyperspace bypass. Alongside these are rules for building, repairing, refitting, and upgrading spaceships - and for inventing new designs and bigger, better systems.

"Nature may abhor a vacuum, but intelligent life adores using it for industry.

"This is the sixth volume in the GURPS Spaceships series by David Pulver (co-author of GURPS Fourth Edition). It requires only the GURPS Basic Set and GURPS Spaceships. GURPS Space is highly recommended for its information on space and celestial bodies to exploit."

66392.name: GURPS Spaceships 7
66392.description:
Subtitled: Divergent and Paranormal Tech

From the Publisher's Website:

"Ether and Magic and Psi . . . Oh My!

"GURPS Spaceships 7: Divergent and Paranormal Tech introduces dozens of new options for spacefaring vessels, allowing them to go where no traditional technology has gone before! Now shipwrights can add tachyon sails, digestive systems, magical power plants, armor made of wood or orichalcum, plus other strange and wonderful innovations. This supplement also provides new rules for unusual or divergent settings: zombie spaceships, pseudo-atmospheric movement, cosmic crystal spheres, and more. Finally, it includes eight ready-to-use vessels that demonstrate the weird options here, such as the ether-crossing Soul Slaver; the psionicly powered psi-jammer; and a spaceship that's the upper torso, head, and arms of a dead god! It also discusses two more "ships" that are actually space monsters – wise captains avoid angering space whales . . .

"With this information, the only limit is your imagination – and even that's not an absolute barrier.

"This is the seventh volume in the GURPS Spaceships series by David Pulver (co-author of GURPS Fourth Edition). It requires only the GURPS Basic Set and GURPS Spaceships. It expands on the tactical combat rules presented in GURPS Spaceships 3: Warships and Space Pirates, adding new options suitable for unusual space vessels."

66393.name: The Noble Wild Character Sheets
66393.description:
Publisher Blurb:

"This is a free supplement to the Pathfinder edition of The Noble Wild, Skirmisher Publishing LLC's Ennie Award-nominated 'Animal Player's Handbook.' Custom features of this four-page set of character sheets include spaces for rules innovations like Boons and Deeds, as well as types of attacks and damage characteristic of animals."

rpg.1297: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

66394.name: The Barrow Mound of Gravemoor

rpgissuearticle.39179: Treasure Chest - Take a peek at some recent Old School releases.

66394.description:
Publisher Blurb:
"The Barrow Mound of Gravemoor is an OSRIC module designed [for] 4-6 adventures of levels 5-7.

"The Highlands are aflame with the fires of rebellion! Barely submissive at the best of times, the restless clans have risen up in arms against the rule of good king Oldavin. What began a few years ago as local disturbances has flared into widespread revolt that saw Oldavin's rule over the Highlands, always superficial at any rate, crumble away like ancient masonry.

"A Highland rebel named Richard Dirkloch has rallied hundreds of bandits, ne'er-do-wells, and restive humanoids to his banner and wages war on the forces of good king Oldavin. He promises booty and freedom from the constraints imposed by law and order, but Dirkloch intends to deliver only death to his followers. Indeed, such is his only goal, the initial step in an insidious plan that could destroy the kingdom of his mortal enemy and restore his beloved bride to life. As his plot reaches fruition, what began as a minor uprising becomes serious, deadly serious."

66395.name: GamesMaster International (Issue 13 - Aug 1991)
66395.description:
From the Contents Page:

•MasterGame: Mayhem with the mechs
•Master of all parties: We invite you to GMI's first awards ceremony
•Soldiers of Fortune: Steve Blease on the miniatures scene
•MasterLive: The LaserQuest cyberzone awaits
•MasterView: The best get put to the test
•MasterPlay: "Storm Clouds over Kuznitsa" prompts a fantasy battle scenario
•MasterPlay: Shadowrun meets Call of Cthulhu in the "Search for the lost city" scenario
•HardWired: A look at the CDTV - the future of computer RPGs?
•MasterView: Alan Crump gets betwen the covers of the latest fantasy novels
•From Pillar to Post: A PBM special delivery from Wayne and Phil Williamson
•Tech Talk: River delta battles in our exclusive Battletech column
•BattleMaster: The Eurolog crew review a great new sci-fi skirmish system, plus there's another chance to enter our fantasy battle competition
•GMI Index: Whats been reviewed and overviewed and where - a guide to our first 12 issues
•Shop of the month: Why the Virgin Games Centre comes out tops
•News & Comment: A new look, a new spot in the magazine but still a rite riveting read
•Masterfile: Convention, clubs and contacts
•MasterMail: You have your say about the grey men in suits
•Critical Mass: Award-winning writer David Langford has a few words

66396.name: Treasure Tables
66396.description:
From the publisher's website:

Dungeon Fantasy 8: Treasure Tables contains everything you need to deck your halls and dungeons, towers, and arcane temples with goodies. Ample tables (almost 50 of them!) let you generate treasures randomly or semi-randomly, if you have something more specific in mind. Or ditch the dice and use some or all of this stuff as a huge "shopping list" for delvers who already have loot but nothing to spend it on. In the chest you'll find:

•Dungeoneering Gear: From maps and books that tell you where the treasure is, through mighty weapons and armor for defeating its guardians, to handy tools to help you get at that choice gem . . . it's all here.
•Enchantments: Quick and easy rules for giving almost any object nearly any magical effect, along with alternatives for self-powered items and some new enchantments.
•Embellishments: Natural and supernatural improvements to workmanship, materials, and appearance that can turn even a bathtub or a serving tray into treasure.
•Curses: Seasoned delvers know that items found in dark domains may exact a price. Is that sword you just found haunted? Will that shiny magic armor generate a mystical backlash? Finding out is part of the thrill!
•Strange Artifacts: Do you dare to utilize the Gears of Time, don the Arms of Ekeshti, or draw from the Cursing Deck? Many shiny finds are beyond the ken of the sagest sage or the wisest wizard.

. . . and much more. A pile of coins is nice, but this supplement lets you achieve the impossible: Ensure that your munchkins players won't want to find boring old silver and gold ever again!

66397.name: Encyclopédie Galactique, Volume 1
66397.description:
User summary:

Encyclopédie Galactique, Volume 1 is a sourcebook containing:

- Informations on the Galactic Empire history and its political organization, its army, guilds and clergy

- Detailed information and rules on space travel, including Faster-Than-Light travel, space combat and boarding actions, spaceship creation

- A scenario pitting Player-Characters against a pirate fleet.

66398.name: Encyclopédie Galactique, Volume 2
66398.description:
User summary:

The second volume of the Encyclopédie Galactique covers the following topics:

- Day-to-day life in the Galactic Empire, with articles describing the Imperial Justice, trading (and black market), communications, imperial culture (including sports and games)

- the different Guilds (Imperial Army, Merchants Hanse, Navyborg guild...), with rules for a character's career in her guild of choice

- Skills, with new skills, rules about teaching, psychic powers, and a set of optional rules to add Perks and disadvantages to characters

The last part of the encyclopedia features two scenarios. The first ("Cas de conscience") has the players explore an uncharted world on behalf of the B.A.I. ("Bureau des Affaires Indigènes", native affairs bureau). The second one ("Le Kerl de Mélancol") puts the players in charge of finding and protecting the successor of the late Imperial religious advisor.

66400.description:
The Easter Bunny Game is a pickup and delivery game in which players of all ages move their bunnies around the board, collecting Easter eggs, and delivering them to homes in time for Easter.

The game is played with chocolate mini-eggs; approximately 24 in four colours are required each game.

If I get the balance right, older kids and adults will enjoy the challenge of planning efficient routes and beating the opponents to the more lucrative destinations, while younger kids will still enjoy scoffing the eggs :)

Ingredients:
12 cards
Board
4 counters
24 miniature chocolate eggs... you'll need a new supply for each game!
66400.name: The Easter Bunny Game

66401.name: KA•GE (Volume 1, Issue 6 - 4th Quarter 1992)
66401.description:
Index:
1 Front Page (Sean Parrack)
2 Notes from the Net (Editorial, Index, Credits - Jim Long)
3 Notes from the Net (Letters)
4 Paterson's Guide to Paranormal Animals (Carrion Crow, Cooper's Fox, Fenris Wolf - Michael W. Harris)
10 KA*GE Fiction (The Night's Change of Plans - Chad Olson)
16 Shadows (Archetypes: Former Electronic Warfare Specialist, Former Combat Engineer - James Buchanan)

19 Neo-Anarchists Guide (Minneapolis-St. Paul metroplex - Michael W. Harris)
23 Turring's Guide to Organizations (MSP Corporations - Michael W. Harris)
27 KA*GE Fiction (Jolly Ol' Elf - Victoria Kirchoff & Curtis Martin)
32 Off the Shelf (Spells and Plasma Shock Weapons - Michael W. Harris, Dentalware - James Rommell, Bomb Sniffer - Jeff Hosty)

45 Shadowrun Network Membership Form
46 Network Member Grafitti
47 Writing on the Wall (News from the Shadowrun Universe)
48 Rear Page

66402.name: European Entertainment
66402.description:
User Summary:

This add-on for Les Divisions de l'Ombre contains:

- a 4-panel gamemaster screen

- a 64 pages booklet describing European Entertainment, an entertainment megacorporation. It describes sports, TV game shows (all suitably violent)... There are also erratas for the game rules and 2 scenarios.

66403.name: Limited Life-Span Theatre
66403.description:
Notice: I have removed the old rules and files due to there being a completely new version in the works, and the previous versions had too many "bugs".

A game full of less brains and more shooting. Create your character, grab some items, and destroy your buddies. Build your play area however you want, using as many or as few obstacles and pickups as desired!

Gameplay consists of drawing weapon and equipment cards as well as special cards to help break the rules. From Death Matches to trying to be the Last Man Standing, there are several match types to suit different styles of play.

Move around the play area by rolling dice and measuring out the distance. It's like a single man skirmish with you trying to be the winning player as you complete the terms of victory for various match types.

66404.name: Liber Newtus
66404.description: A collection of 4 Glorantha and 1 Mythic Russia adventures, printed and sold as a fundraiser at the Contiuum 2008 convention.

66409.name: Avant Charlemagne: Au temps des rois barbares
66409.description:
User summary:

"Avant Charlemagne" is a French RPG created by François Nédelec. Set in Europe between the end of the western Roman empire and the reign of Charlemagne (500 to 800 AD), it blended a highly detailed and realistic historic background with fantasy elements.

The core book contains the rules, a solo scenario, 110 pages of historic background and an 80 pages long compaign.

66410.description:
Get ready for the battle of the ages when you go head to head in a series of dinosaur duels!

Is your Stegosaurus strong enough to defeat your opponent's Apatosaurus?

Let the fun and the dino duels begin!

The Dino Duel Card Game is one dino-mite game to play! Players lay down their cards in a duel. On the top of the cards is located the point value. If your Stegosaurus card contains more points than your opponent's T-Rex card, then you win that set of cards. The cards feature the Tyrannosaurus Rex, Apatosaurus, Stegosaurus, and wild cards. Any number of combinations can create different outcomes. The player with the most sets wins!

Contains 48 cards (measuring 4 1/2" x 3") and instructions. No reading required to play.
66410.name: Dino Duel

66411.name: Pimp my Paladin
66411.description:
Contents from the book:

Divine Host (class), Arcane Templar (class), Divine Vagrant (prc), 4 new spells, 7 new magic items, 7 new feats, and 4 artifact items.

66413.name: Flick Pool
66413.description: Flick Pool is a dexterity game distributed in Whataburger kids meals. It consists of round tiles and triangular "pockets". Players take turns flicking the Cue Ball into other balls to try to get them in the pockets. It's just like pool, but smaller and flatter.

66414.name: Race to Read
66414.description:
As players roll the die, they make their way around a colorful racetrack. When they land on different colored spaces, players choose cards that ask them to figure out parts of speech, noun plurals, verb tenses, blends, homophones, definitions, idioms, context clues, anagrams and more. As players correctly answer questions, they power ahead on the track. Teachers can choose how many laps to complete to adapt to time constraints. Covers the following aspects of Bloom's Taxonomy: Knowledge, Comprehension, Application, Analysis

* Compact size saves space on the shelf and in the classroom
* High-interest graphics and content
* Short passages allow time for full comprehension and the chance to read a variety of topics
* Winning is based on knowledge and skills, not random factors
* Games address important content, not trivia
* Directions are easy to understand, so as not to restrict learning opportunities
* Players never lose points for wrong answers

66415.name: Gauntlet
66415.description:
Gauntlet - From the Klix Pocket Travel Games from Tiger Electronics.

The board folds out, the magnetic pieces (which function as both player pieces and tokens for the potion track) are stored in a built-in compartment and the dice are self-contained in a see-through compartment. The dice are 'rolled' by pushing and releasing the 'dice snapper'.

The board itself is broken into four sections: "Room 1", "Room 2", "Room 1-3 Treasure Room" and "Room 4". The players take turns moving through the rooms in order, landing on one of four kinds of space: a blank space, a space with food on it (which adds to the players food/HP), a space with a ghost on it (which subtracts from the same), and a space with a bomb (which advances the players 'potion track' by one). The final space on the Room 4 board contains the 'Sacred Orb'.

66416.description:
The Crow and the Pitcher is a trick-taking game based on the Aesop fable of the same name. Players must play off one another in order to gain points, but the highest suited card is not always the one that takes the trick, so one must be as clever as the Crow in Aesop's fable to score points and not perish from thirst.

The deck consists of three colored suits of stone cards (numbered 2-10) and one set of black "thirst" cards (also numbered 2-10); a separate deck of pitcher cards has values from 6 to 13, with some duplicates, and one pitcher is revealed each trick. One player leads the first trick with a stone card, and other players must follow suit, if possible. If a player cannot follow suit, she can play a thirst card instead, and from the next round thirst cards can lead the trick. Whoever wins a trick leads the next trick, so winning tricks helps you dictate play.

If the sum of the colored cards is less than the pitcher value, then the lowest card matching the lead wins; this player gets all cards played (positive points for colors, negative for thirst) and the Pitcher card (worth -5 points). If the sum of the colored cards is equal to or greater than the pitcher value, then the highest card matching the lead wins, and this player gets all cards played (again, positive points for colors, negative for thirst). In all cases, cards valued higher than the trick's pitcher card do not count toward determining whether the pitcher is full.

If the trick is led by a thirst card, the highest thirst card wins, and that player takes all thirst cards played – so make sure you hold onto your low value thirst cards to avoid winning a thirst-led trick!

After three rounds, the player with the high score wins.
66416.name: The Crow and the Pitcher

66417.name: Zombacalypse (Aether Edition)
66417.description:
From the back of the book:

It’s already too late to run…
The Zombie Apocalypse is upon us! The End is HERE!
In this book, you’ll find ways to introduce zombies into any game, set any time and anywhere. A multitude of zombification theories are presented for use or inspiration, as well as campaign ideas to fight against them. The core of the book centers around creating the undead machines, and using 13 separate qualities, each with 4 separate levels of ability, any kind of zombie can be created. Any type of zombie can be emulated from any source, or you could create your own. Eleven types of sample zombies are given in the book, from the easy to put down, easy to run from Slow Zombies, to the deadly assassins known only as Shadow Stalkers.
The book is designed inherently to work with the Æther Role-Playing System, but if that’s not your system of choice, rules have been included to supply a framework that can port the zombies from Æther into a myriad of different systems. In the same spirit, the book contains 30 scenario ideas to act as adventure hooks and campaign spring boards that are not specific to any given RPG system. Additionally, rules for running a Horror game are inherent in the book, but certainly not required, giving your players and their characters the extra challenge of escaping with their minds and their bodies intact.

66418.name: Lizardfolk
66418.description:
From the front cover:

Hundreds of pre-generated lizardfolk ready for use in your game.
Class levels, templates, variant builds.
No rolling required
The Lazy GM: We Work, You Play!

From the introduction:

The creatures presented here have been selectively pre-generated with class levels and templates. For reasons of space, and the sanity of the author, we have not attempted to provide every possible combination of class, level and template. What is given here are a wide range of basic creature and a few ‘character’ style opponents. The levels chosen for the standard types of opponents are derived from the range of levels listed in the SRD entry for that particular creature. Some class combinations are chosen according to the ‘implied culture’ of the MM listings of the creatures. Favoured class and the creature’s typical role in adventures have been borne in mind during creation, but some unexpected combinations have been included for variety.
The concept is that you should be able to copy and paste appropriate opponents into your own adventures, or print out sheets as needed rather than print out the entire book in one block, although there
is no reason not to do so.

66420.name: Days of Knights
66420.description:
From the back of the book:

A Tale of Medieval Chivalry
In a long forgotten time, in a long forgotten place, a tale of valor and chivalry unfolds. A Princess is kidnapped and valiant knights step forth to rescue her from the evil King and his minions. Will this saga have a fairy tale ending? Only you can decide!
Days of Knights is the first in a series called One Shot Adventures.
These scenarios are created to help introduce new players to the hobby of role playing. Each adventure uses a simple skill based resolution mechanic that is easy to learn and fun to play.
One Shot Adventures can also be used by more experienced gamers to
fill the gap between campaigns or when a few of the regular players can’t make game night for whatever reason. If you don’t like the included mechanics, simply plug in your favorite and go with it!

66421.name: Divine Quests
66421.description:
From the introduction:

Making lists is not a new activity in the world of RPGs. Just open up a few books or computer files to see this in action. Of course, no list can encompass everything. Myths, legends and even the stories of today have bits you can steal for your own game.
So, why even write this list? This is a response to those who have said they have trouble envisioning adventures for PCs with god-like levels of power. Such difficulties are understandable. The threat of being broke and not having shelter or looking for the “MacGuffin” isn’t important because the wants and needs of humans differ from those of gods.

66422.name: Divine Homelands
66422.description:
From advertisement for product:

Need a place for your gods to live? How about an interesting dimensional plane to raid? If so, you have come to the right place.
Divine Homelands is a 20-page supplement for the Divinity RPG system. However, it is written so that it can be used to create the framework for a realm without buying the core book. It does this by using a point system to buy up certain qualities. It also includes sample realms as well.
So, c'mon, give your Divinities a home. Give them a Divine Homeland.

66423.name: S.L.A.M. Soldier
66423.description:
User Summary:

S.L.A.M (Subspace Looped Armor Materialization) soldier is a new character class for d20 Modern

66424.description:
A tale of teamwork and betrayal!

The mole ogre howled out as it collapsed into a bloody pile of rent flesh and broken bone. The aging knight bent over, panting heavily, and gave his dwarven peer an approving nod. It had taken great effort between them both to slay the beast, and they had each taken their share of wounds. But in the end their cooperation had paid off and they both knew it. And then their eyes found the treasure chest sitting in the corner of the room.

They looked at each other. They looked back at the treasure... and then the real fight began.

The game where YOU are the final boss!

Dungeon Run is an exciting dash through a dungeon packed with monsters and traps. Each player controls a unique hero capable of great feats, and whose powers and abilities are upgradable and customizable throughout the game. Players can work together to overcome the perils of the dungeon, or they can betray and sabotage each other as they see fit. Because in the final room of the dungeon lurks a powerful boss with the ultimate treasure - a treasure that turns its owner into the most powerful warrior they can become! Slay the boss, steal the treasure, and then run for your life as your friends try to cut you down. In Dungeon Run only one hero can escape with the fabled Summoning Stone. Don't crawl - run!

Dungeon Run features a randomly assembled dungeon that changes each time you play, as do the monsters you face and the treasures you find. Eight different heroes each with unique options for customization further add to a wealth of game play options. Choose the vicious Tundra Orc and bash your way through everything that stands in your path. Play as the cunning Grounder Wizard and use your magic to cheat the laws of nature. Select the Guild Dwarf adventurer and lay traps to ensnare your friends. There are many paths to victory in Dungeon Run. Win by working with your friends or against them - just win!
66424.name: Dungeon Run

66425.name: The Dream Healers
66425.description:
From the publisher's website:

Though often seen as a priestly order, the dream healers follow no set god. For them, the power of healing lies within the patient and their dreams. Able to enter another’s dreams, they guide their patients through past events, allowing them to relive them and heal many wounds that other healers cannot touch. The journey is not without risk, for the world within a dream becomes a new reality, and death there comes just as easily as in the waking world.

The Dream Healers is an ebook detailing a drop-in organization for your Fantasy game, complete with history, tenets, organizational structures, ways of joining, and ready-to-use NPCs. It also includes the dream healer prestige class and two new magical items.

66426.name: Situation Report!
66426.description:
subtitled: A Collection of Situations Engineered for Quick Play

From the introduction:

What’s All This, Then?

Situation Report! is something I should have done a long, long time ago — it is a package of the four situations I engineered for playing Full Light, Full Steam at conventions. It also includes the six “half-gen” characters that the situations are geared for. Armed with Situation Report!, anybody can give the game a spin, getting right into play without building their own campaign.

66427.name: Barbarians Versus
66427.description:
From the introduction:

You hail from the icy north, a land of snowy, jagged peaks. You are trained to kill; you are molded to survive. You are a legend among warriors. You are a barbarian.
Barbarians Versus is an easy to learn, fast-paced, action-oriented roleplaying game. You play a barbarian from the cold north, far from your homeland in search of honor and treasure. Bring back riches and trophies, and you will be the pride of your clan. Bring back the most riches and trophies, and you will be a legend among barbarians.
However, the normal raiding season has turned out to be unusual. Word has spread among the various barbarian parties throughout the countryside -- castles, cities, and villages are empty and deserted. In their place, reptilian aliens from beyond the sky have built sprawling slave camps and massive factories. These evil creatures are armed with unusual weapons -- iron sticks that shoot lightning, delicate stones that explode upon impact with humans, flying chariots that arc through the sky, and invisible walls that shock those why try to escape. To gain honor this year, the barbarians will have to take the battle to these alien invaders or go home empty-handed. Of course, what self-respecting barbarian would do that?
If you like to make up stories about savage barbarians and the creatures they smash to tiny bits, Barbarians Versus is for you.

66428.name: The Great City: Player's Guide

rpghonor.13599: 2010 ENnies - Best Electronic Book - Gold Winner

66428.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The sourcebook contains new races, residences in the Great City, taxation, religion, azindralean tongs, organizations, new core classes, new prestige classes, professions, feats, spells, Great City specific equipment, gaslight technology, weather and climate, calendar and days of the week, constellations and Auspicious signs and more.

The Great City is rife with excitement, intrigue and adventure; dare your characters make it their home?

The Great City Player's Guide features (among the other things):
• Five Base classes: Cultkiller, Ghostblade, Guttermage, Neopagan and Urbanist.
• Seven Prestige Classes: Crossroad Guardian, Insurrectionist, Moon Warrior (Warrior of the Silver Lady), Numismatist, Rooftop Runner, Sewer Runner, and Shadow Mage of the Gray Consortium.

From Foreword by Tim Hitchcock:
"The Great City Player’s Guide provides a wealth of information for Players and Game Masters alike concerning all things urban, at least in the Great City. That’s not to say you can’t use the material within in other settings; you can! The mechanical elements herein are 100% compatible with the brand new Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook and still play fine with the old d20 SRD. It’s just that we tried very hard to make sure the book captured the flavor we’ve been working on for the Great City. For those of you familiar with our product line, you’ll be pleased of how much setting material we incorporated into this book. Things like how the constellations might affect you, new Pathfinder traits you can gain for being a member of one of the city’s numerous organizations or tongs. New core classes like the ghostblade and the guttermage, and even a barrister NPC class for those PCs needing good legal representation.

"This time out, I’ve called upon a greater variety of writers as well. Sure, I tried to use the old favorites who designed the original Great City and Great City Adventure Arcs. Yet I was also fortunate enough to be able to incorporate a few other very talented writers as well. This, of course, is what happens in every great city: change and progress. I hope you find it as fantastic and enjoyable as I did to read their interpretations and fresh ideas on what might be going on in the Great City."

66429.name: Archipelago (Second Edition)
66429.description:
From the game's introduction:

Archipelago is a story/role-playing game where each player controls a major character. Players take turns directing and playing out a part of their character's story, leading them towards their selected point of destiny, while other players interact with and influence that story.

Who is this game for?

If you like the story-telling part of games, and enjoy the creative challenge and inspiration that comes from working with others, this game is for you. If you like tactical mechanics, resource management, or player-vs-player competition, there are other games that might work better for you.

The vibe I'm aiming for

I wrote this game trying to capture the feeling of Ursula K. LeGuin's Earthsea books. I wanted a game of grand destinies, that at the same time had time to dwell on the details of plants, words, everyday lives. I wanted a game that was about great conflicts, but at the same time treated its characters' stories with respect. I wanted not a steel framework, but a spider web of thin threads creating subtler stories.

This game works best if you play it slow. Sometimes, the best thing to do is wait a little and see how things unfold. Ged stayed with Ogion for years, learning about the old language, the names of flower petals and bugs. There's time to let the characters evolve.

Breathe in. Breathe out. Take your time.

66430.name: Archipelago (First Edition)

rpghonor.13911: 2008 Indie RPG Awards - Best Supplement - Runner Up

66430.description:
From the game's introduction:

Archipelago is a story/role-playing game where each player controls a major character. Player take turns telling a part of their character's story, leading them towards their selected point of destiny, while other players interact with and influence that story.

Who is this game for?

If you like the story-telling part of games, and enjoy the creative challenge and inspiration that comes from working with others, this game is for you. If you like tactical mechanics, resource management, or player-vs-player competition, there are other games that might work better for you.

66436.name: Rakete
66436.description:
One of the "Easyplay Kids" series. This one is a simple dice-roller.

Each player has a set of five 6-sided dice showing one of five different monsters and a rocket. One monster is revealed at random from a deck of five cards and players simultaneously roll their dice (one at a time). The round ends when one player has four dice matching the monster on the card and the fifth die does not show the rocket.

The losers pay the winner in "Mars Maggot" tokens (to feed the monster). If they can't afford to pay then they must discard a "Rocket" token. The first player to lose all their rocket tokens loses the game; the Player with the most "Mars Maggot´s" win.

66437.description:
In Souvlaki Wars, players are owners of Greek restaurants serving traditional greek fast food like "souvlaki" and "gyros". They try to attract new customers, making sure they can serve them in time, increasing their fortune and fame at the same time.

Of course, this is easier said than done as many things can go wrong while trying to serve a customer: People change their minds, orders go wrong and restaurant owners try to sabotage each other.

Can you become the most successful Greek restaurant owner?

Souvlaki Wars is a light family card game for 2-4 players. Players draft new customers and try to serve them with food cards they draw at the beginning of each turn. This way they earn the money and the reputation each customer represents. However, before they have a chance to do so, cards with "Unforeseen Events" are played by every player, affecting the game in many different ways like altering the order in lines, adding more customers, decreasing the opponent's reputation etc. And of course, each player has to take into consideration that the customers are served on a first-come basis. If someone's order can't be fulfilled, everyone behind him will have to wait another turn...

The first player to reach a certain level of money and reputation is declared the winner.

The game is going to be published by the Greek company "Kaissa Chess & Games" during 2011. It is going to be bilingual, having text both in Greek and English. Its international debut will be at the 2011 Spiel Essen fair.

- Winner of BGG's Greek Guild's 1st Game Design Contest in the category: "Best Game"
66437.name: Souvlaki Wars

66440.name: Crawling for Cash
66440.description:
Sometimes you just want the simple pleasure of sticking a sword into an orc and walking away with its gold.

This game will let you do that. It's about trying to make a living killing monsters.

(From product description)

66441.name: Battle with the Swedes for Charles Bridge
66441.description:
From the rules: "In the course of the cruel Thirty Years' War, the people inhabiting the Czech Lands were subjected to many invasions by Swedish mercenaries who looted burghers' houses, aristocratic palaces, churches, libraries and monasteries. Regardless of whether they were led by Generals Baner, Torstenson or Wrangel, the Swedes always wanted to take away as much as they could . . . On the night of July 25, 1648, the Swedish cavalry tried to conquer the Stone Bridge (today's Charles Bridge) and penetrate the Old Town through the gate in the Old Town bridge tower . . .The people of Prague, and particularly students led by Father Jiri Plachy, quickly took up arms and rushed to help the tiny unit of the tower guards. A fierce hand-to-hand fight ensued, with the fighters on both sides hiding behind the the statues on the bridge. The battle took the toll of many dead and wounded on both sides. The present game is based on this particular battle with all its snares and personal fights."

The rules are in Czech, English, German and French. The board is a simple checkerboard-type surface on medium-weight cardboard. The only other components are 28 small wooden blocks, 14 dyed red, 14 in their natural light brown coloring. There is a coin on the front of the box that is tossed at the start of the game to determine how many moves the Swedish player gets.

Each player places their 14 men on the first two rows of squares on each side of the board. The men can move one square in 12 possible directions. You eliminate your opponent's men by landing on their square and can take another turn provided you can eliminate another man with that move. All men can jump over each other. The player who has more of his men on the starting line of his rival when no one can make any more moves wins.

66442.name: Whog Shrog

rpgissuearticle.136973: Aide de Jeu Whog Shrog: Renegats

66442.description:
Whog Shrog is one of the games in the Universom rules system. PCs are ubersoldiers - the Whog Shrogs - in service to Takerus, the Butcher of the Universe, a wannabe ruler of all known planets. Loaded with superweapons, advanced martial training, and indoctrination, they roam the galaxy to destroy the Butcher's enemies. However, as they come to know these, they might no longer be interested in expanding the Butcher's dominion.

The game features grandiose settings and epic battles in the style of French sci-fi comics author Druillet.

User Summary:

The core rules for Whog Shrog. The book contains:


The game rules, including character creation, piloting, combat, space battles, other intelligent species and non-Whog Shrog characters



Description of the game universe, the planets ruled by the Butcher, the Sunrith Empire, and detailed information on the Whog Shrog legions



A 15-page scenario ("Warpage Total"), introducing the player to the joys of being a Whog Shrog warrior

66443.name: Metal Fantaisy
66443.description:
User Summary:

Metal Fantaisy is the only additional material released for Whog Shrog beyond the core rulebook. It contains:


New rules for adding robots in the game, and playing one



A chapter discussing Loks (archenemies of the player characters), how to create them and what their powers are



A description of a planetary system ("l'Archipel"), of the 34 planets that are part of it and their inhabitants



Rules for drugs



New artillery weapons



2 scenarios ("Santa la Chienne" and "Tropiques Blindés") taking place in the Archipel

66444.name: Down Among the Dead Men
66444.description:
Book 2 in the Virtual Reality series.

From the back of the book:
"Adrift at sea in an open boat, you make your desperate bid to escape from the evil pirate Skarvench. The odds are stacked against you, for, even if you do not die of thirst, there are still formidable dangers to overcome. And if you do survive to reach civilization, your adventure is only just beginning since you must round up a crew and sail in search of Skarvench and avenge his tyranny. But will you be able to thwart his most evil and blackguardly scheme ever: to kidnap the beautiful young Queen of Glorianne?"

66445.name: The Coils of Hate
66445.description:
Book 3 in the Virtual Reality series.

From the back of the book:
"Alone in the labyrinthine streets of the ancient city of Godorno, you frantically attempt to save your people - the Judian - from their tyrannical ruler, the Overlord. Terrified of being hunted down, the Judain have gone to ground. But now there is an even greater menace: Hate, the very embodiment of all that is sinister, has invaded the city. Its tentacles emerge form the sewers beneath the city, destroying everything. No one is safe. Will you be able to vanquish Hate and prevent the annihilation of your people?"

66446.name: Necklace of Skulls
66446.description:
Book 4 in the Virtual Reality series.

From the back of the book:
"Learning of the disappearance of your twin brother in the trackless desert, you resolve to set out and discover his fate. Leaving the hub of your elaborate Mayan civilization far behind, your quest takes you to lost jungle cities, across mountains and seas, and even to the baleful depths of the underworld. If you are lucky enough to survive the treacherous desert journey, you must still confront the wizard call Necklace of Skulls in a deadly contest whose stakes are nothing less that your own soul."

66447.name: Twist of Fate
66447.description:
Book 6 in the Virtual Reality series.

From the back of the book:
"An evil and crafty nobleman has cheated you of all your wealth. But rather than starve as a beggar on the streets of Baghdad, you decide to leave in search of fame and fortune. Your travels take you to ghoul-haunted oases, magical palaces, lost cities of gold and uncharted isles full of mystery and danger. Threatened by bandits, fire wizards, thieves and fearsome creatures, you must risk all in your determined quest for justice."

66448.name: Discordia (5/5/5 edition)
66448.description:
From the game's introduction:

This is a roleplaying game. That means you play a role. The role you'll be playing is a Discordian Double Agent, fighting against the tyranny of Order and those who would impose their dogma upon others. Sure, those others are just sleeping sheep who want to be lead around, but that doesn't mean they deserve to be lead around, does it? Hell no. You've got a right and duty to do something about it. One of those things is more important than the other - right and duty, I mean - but I'm not telling which is which.

To begin, you need a character: your Discordian Double Agent. While you are a Discordian and you worship Eris with all your heart, you've also managed to infiltrate one of the Illumanati: the true masters of the world. Forget world governments; they're just puppets on strings. The true masters of the world are organizations so vast, ancient and faceless that they can never be stopped. Especially by the likes of you.

66449.name: GamesMaster International (Issue 14 - Sep 1991)
66449.description:
From the Contents Page:

•MasterGame: Probably the most detailed fantasy RPG World, Harn
•Soldiers of Fortune: This month's miniatures column features another discount offer
•MasterView: GMI reviews another crop of new scenarios,rules and sourcbooks
•MasterPlay: A bleak future world comes to life in our generic sceanrio, "Body and Soul"
•HardWired: All that's new in computer RPGs
•MasterLive: A change is as good as a rest, so here's LRP news from around the country
•MasterPlay: High-tech horror once more: Part two of the "Search for the lost city" scenario
•MasterView: Specially imported at no extra cost, Alan Crump's book reviews
•MasterPiece: Margaret Weis and Tracy Hickman prove they've come a long way since Dragonlance
•RuleMaster: Following up on our Snakes Alive! article of issue 12, sneaky, slithering snake stats
•Shop of the month: An RPG establishment well worth a visit, Leisure Games
•From Pillar to Post: Wayne bring you up-to-date with the PBM scene and Martin Webb reviews Eidolon and Ameat
•Tech Talk: I FIBA you not! Containing mechs for combat in built up area
•BattleMaster: A beginner to the massed battle scene? The lads from Eurolog will give you a helping hand
•News & Comment: Dr Who, aliens, miniatures, Summerfest and Once upon a Con feature in this months news
•Masterfile: clubs and contacts, keep in touch
•MasterMail: A selection of missives from our bulging mailbag
•Critical Mass: Shock! Horror! David Langford admits he's not perfect

66450.description:
A special expansion tile available at LeiriaCon 2010 exclusive of Spiel Portugal and later re-released at Spiel 2013 in Essen

The first player to fill his 6 spaces enclosure gets the lynx tile and puts it next to his barn. The players keep the Lynx until the end of the game.

At the end of the game, after the last truck is chosen and before the scoring phase, the owner of the Lynx may carry out one extra money action. He still has to pay the cost for this action.

Expands:

Zooloretto




Home Page & Newsletter:

www.zooloretto.com




(German, english, dutch, hungarian, spanish, swedish)
66450.name: Zooloretto: Iberian Lynx

66451.name: Wunderwelten (Issue 32 - Jul 1996)
66451.description:
(User summary)
Issue 32 of the Wunderwelten magazine, containing:

editorial
news
book reviews
game reviews
CCGs reviews, including Netrunner

article on arrows, part 2
campaigns in Battletech
