earthdawn-scenario: Winternacht

66452.name: Wunderwelten (Issue 33 - Sep 1996)
66452.description:
(User summary)
Issue 33 of the Wunderwelten magazine, containing:

editorial
news
book reviews
game reviews
CCGs reviews, including Perry Rhodan

article on Tabletops
Battletech - mechanics
Blumenkamp on censorship

preview on Inferno (tabletop)

review on the World of Darkness
DSA: article on mercenaries

Citytech-scenario: Der erste Kontakt
Shadowrun-scenario: Auf Sendung
earthdawn-scenario: Der Kuss

66454.name: Wunderwelten (Issue 34 - Nov 1996)
66454.description:
(User summary)
Issue 34 of the Wunderwelten magazine, containing:

editorial
news
book reviews
game reviews

article on tabletops part 2
article on Gencon 96
article on LARPS
article on Orcs
World of Darkness, part 2
phantastic movies

DSA: the theatre "Kaiserliche Yaquirbühne zu Bomed"
earthdawn: Throal, the dwarf kingdom

earthdawn-scenario: Der Kuss, part 2
shadowrun-scenario: Die Nacht der Ghule

shadowrun-short story: Gute Vorsätze
shadowrun-scenario: Die Nacht der Ghule

66455.name: Wunderwelten (Issue 35 - Jan 1997)
66455.description:
(User summary)
Issue 35 of the Wunderwelten magazine, containing:

editorial
news
book reviews
game reviews

article on Larp, part 2
article on tabletops, part 3
Battletech mechanics: artillery
Bluemnkamp on Xmas
preview and interview on the Boarbarad-campaign (DSA)
Interview with Robin D. Laws (earthdawn, feng shui)

earthdawn: Mahatsch, trade town
DSA: Castle Moorwacht

battletech-scenario: Reunion
DSA-scenario: Die Nacht der Wölfe
Cthulhu-Scenario: Wanderer zwischen den Welten

66456.name: Wunderwelten (Issue 36 - Mar 1997)
66456.description:
(User summary)
Issue 36 of the Wunderwelten magazine, containing:

editorial
news
book reviews
game reviews

Demonworld - scenario report

article on Traveller

article: how to drive the GM or the players crazy

horses in RPGs

Star Trek: spaceships of the fleet

article on tabletops, part 4

article on the Yakuza

shadowrun-scenario: Koma
Vampire: tdA - scenario: Sub-rosa
DSA-scenario: Die Nacht der Jagd

66457.name: House of Spirits
66457.description:
THIS GAME HAS BEEN DISCONTINUED.

No one knows what has led each of you to this cursed house on the hill, but here you all stand, poised to enter. The previous owner was rumored to have discovered the secrets of the house. Can you recover the fragments of his diary before it’s too late? You’ll have to work together but look out for number one while doing so.

In House of Spirits, players explore a haunted house together, room by room. Along the way they will draw cards representing weapons and other items to help them survive the various beasts within. Each player gets one action per turn, so he has to balance long term strategy against short term gains. Do you risk taking on that werewolf, hoping to claim points at the risk of precious health, or leave it for someone else to deal with?

The ultimate goal of the game is to get more points than any other player. There are numerous ways to do this depending on player strategy, as well as a dash of luck.

66459.description:
From Publisher:

At the height of the industrial revolution, the Great Empire is about to take delivery of many secret crates from its colonies. These crates contain all the Emperor needs to strengthen his rule on the Empire: steel, coal, ore, and above all: gold! For security reasons, the Emperor himself has hand-picked the crew of the Nostria, one of the armored zeppelins of the imperial fleet. However, neighboring nations are organizing the resistance, and traitors are secretly boarding the airship to thwart the Emperor’s plans.

Mad Zeppelin is a fast-paced card game of sabotage, as you use your traitors to throw the most cargo off the Nostria and ruin the Emperor's plans. The player who destroys the most cargo wins, but you must assure you properly bribe the guards each turn, or your chances of sabotage may end at the point of a bayonet!

Contains: 14 Traitor cards - 100 Cargo cards of different categories - 10 Journey cards, used to mark the course of the voyage - 3 special dice - 30 tokens representing gold pieces.
66459.name: Mad Zeppelin

66460.name: Diceopolis
66460.description: This is a strategic placement game wherein each of 2 to 4 players begins with 25 regular 6-sided dice. In the center of the playing surface is a cross of dice ("the wall" - see diagram) against which dice are placed to score. Each die placed must touch two other dice, and only dice touching the same number in the wall in an uninterrupted perpendicular alignment will score. (Two players may begin with 36 dice each if available.)

66461.name: Cheese Merchandiser
66461.description:
Every player gets 20 cards in his/her color. Try to get a product together with four cards.
The objective of the game is to put the products on the board as favorable as possible. The player who puts his product on the middle of the board gets the most points.
The player throw two dice and put his/her two pawns on the grid of the board. Where the two pawns come together, a player can put a card of his/her product.
If there is already a card, a player can change the card (only if he/she is the owner of the product). Or can try to get the space for his own product.(players throw dice to get the space)
When a player has placed all his/her products on the board, the counting begins. The player with the most points wins the game.

66462.name: Illuminati for Risus
66462.description:
From the author's introduction:

I have always loved conspiracy theories, especially ones about the Illuminati. The concept of numerous 'illuminated' conspiracies fighting amongst themselves, as popularized in the ILLUMINATUS! trilogy by Robert Shea and Robert Anton Wilson and in the Illuminati and Illuminati: New World Order card games by Steve Jackson Games has everything needed for a good RPG campaign. To the best of my knowledge (apologies etc. if I'm wrong) this is the first such campaign for Risus. This is the first time I'm trying to write something for Risus, so please forgive anything in it that sucks.

66463.name: Risus: The Matrix
66463.description:
From the author's introduction:

A Risus campaign based on The Matrix.

This document is recommended only for people who have seen the movie The Matrix and understand the plot. While a brief background description is given, it is not enough to play a full campaign. The Matrix's bizzare and paranoid plot (not to mention the badass moves) lend themselves perfectly to an RPG.

66464.description:
There are 80 cards with questions at the front of the card. At the back of the cards there are collered lines (the ski arenas). The group or player who gets the longest line, wins the game.

The question are truth or style. If a player answers a question correctly or follows the instructions , he/she gets the card. Otherwise the card is put back in the box.

Contents:
- 80 cards
- 1 CD (just for fun)
66464.name: Après Ski Het Spel

66465.name: Risus: Troubleshooter
66465.description:
From the author's introduction:

A Risus campaign set in a world on the verge of becoming cyberpunk.

66466.name: Multimondes
66466.description:
User summary:

This is the core box set for Multimondes.

The box contains:

- a 48 pages rulebook ("Le Jeu") covering the game rules and character creation. Characters can come from Earth, Mars, Venus or Troie and have to choose a career - BioLog, ManTech, PhiLog or WarTek. Players have to answer an "orientation questionnaire" in order to determine their character's personality. The box came with a disk containing a program to help with the questionnaire.

- a 5"1/4 disk containing the character generation program for MS-DOS PC

- a 96 pages booklet ("Le Contexte") with the game universe background and 2 scenarios, "Opération Miroir" and "L'Ile de Fer"

- a 48 pages booklet (called "High Tech") with description of gear, weapons, vehicles, robots...

- a booklet with 16 character record sheets.

66467.name: Heavy Ordnance Lite
66467.description:
From the author's introduction:

Little kids and big guns. 'Nuff said. A stand-alone adaption of Heavy Ordnance to the Risus engine.

Welcome to Heavy Ordnance Lite. Heavy Ordnance is a satirical Roleplaying Game where the players play prepubescent school children with large military surplus weaponry. A nasty accident, involving some weapons grade plutonium and the cafeteria meat loaf, has blasted portions of your hometown into the many levels of hell; and all citizens the elder side of puberty have been turned into brain sucking monsters. Luckily, your Elementary School was built next door to the local National Guard base, and you and the rest of your fifth grade class have armed themselves. Now all you have to do is figure out which end of the bazooka is the business end, before the Principal smashes down the door and snacks on your entrails.

66468.description:
80 color pages, articles mainly analyze beach landings in both the ETO and PTO. Includes map LFT 2 (very large hill), two ASL solo scenarios, and 10 ASL scenarios, focusing on the Pacific Theater and the Chinese Civil War, almost all in English.

Scenarios:

SASL FT-1 Hit Them Hard: You play Nationalist Chinese forces trained by the Germans involved in a counter-attack in Shanghai, 15 August 1937.
SASL FT-2 Against Ill Advice: You play Japanese army troops sent ahead in Malaya to defend a beach against British counterattacks.
ASL FT 136 Shanghai by Sea: Nationalist Chinese versus Japanese Shanghai Expeditionary Force making a beach assault in Wusong (south of Shanghai), 23 August 1937.
ASL FT 137 300: Last stand in Shanghai of the Nationalist Chinese 88th Division (German-trained) against the Japanese Shanghai Expeditionary Force, 30 October 1937.
ASL FT 138 Meeting Up at Matan: Nationalist Chinese against Japan's Formosa Infantry Brigade west of Wuhan, 24 June 1938.
ASL FT 139 Ride of the 200th: Japanese Infantry versus Nationalist Chinese armor in Kunlun Pass in south China, 19 December 1939.
ASL FT 140 Chinese Raiders: Nationalist Chinese irregular forces fighting in Vietnam against Vichy French helped by Meos partisan forces, 1-2 June 1942.
ASL FT 141 Easy Day at Volupai: Japanese infantry versus U.S. marines in New Britain, 6 March 1944.
ASL FT 142 Cut, Slash and Mow Down: U.S. infantry defend against elements of the crack Japanese 6th infantry on Bougainville, 24 March 1944.
ASL FT 143 Red Scare: Fighting between Nationalist and Communist Chinese forces in North China, 13 November 1948.
ASL FT 144 Tigers of Pantang: Fighting between Nationalist and Communist Chinese in North China, 16 November 1948.
ASL FT 145 Bears of Kinmen: Nationalist infantry defend against Communist Chinese beach assaults on Kinmen Island, just off the coast of Fukien province, 25 October 1949.




Magazine Contents:

Editor's Foreword
Hexdraw, a voyage into "Kibbling"
Kill the Monsters!
Very very few products [sic] reviews
10 question to... Klas Malmstrom
Tournaments and Meetings
Japanese Island Defenses
The Chinese Infantry Battalion
Iloilo Museum
Chronology: the Japanese/Chinese war
Chronology: the Chinese Civil war
Play fast?
Sims Ridge AAR
PTO Basis
Sons of Beaches
Seaborne Assaults
Gavutu-Tanambogo
Bibliography
Sims Ridge scenario custom map
66468.name: Le Franc Tireur #12: PTO and Chinese Civil War for ASL

66469.name: Heavy Ordnance
66469.description:
From the game's introduction:

Welcome to Heavy Ordnance, the second Roleplaying Game to use the Reflex System.

Heavy Ordnance is a satirical Roleplaying Game where the players play prepubescent school children with large military surplus weaponry. A nasty accident, involving some weapons grade plutonium and the cafeteria meat loaf, has blasted portions of your hometown into the many levels of hell; and all citizens the elder side of puberty have been turned into brain sucking monsters. Luckily, your Elementary School was built next door to the local National Guard base, and yourself, and the rest of your fifth grade class, have armed themselves. Now all you have to do is figure out which end of the bazooka is the business end, before the Principal smashes down the door and snacks on your entrails.

66470.name: Turn of Mind: A Game of Psychological Type
66470.description:
The player will be able to identify the four elements of a psychological type and state the type represented by the phrases on the cards. The learner will be able to distinguish characteristics of the pairs of opposites represented by the phrases on each card.

The goal of the game is to form a hand comprised of one psychological type and three characteristics of one of the four areas of preference. The three characteristics must be the opposite of the one used to form the type.

Components:
52 cards

66471.name: Vertebrate Classification
66471.description:
The players will be able to correctly classify contemporary and extinct chordates according to physical characteristics.

Players try to create the classification hierarchy. Players must correctly identify which Genus belongs to which Order, and which Orders belong to which Class. This can be done from memory, or by reading the Genus characteristics on the cards and matching with them with correct Order characteristics.

As players obtain cards they will be able to place them in the play area if a higher card has already been placed in the play area. (for example a Genus card can only be placed in the play area if and only if it's Order card is available.)
The game is won when a complete hierarchy is built.

Components:
126 cards
- 21 Order cards
- 35 Class cards
- 70 Genus cards

66472.name: Visual A "peel"
66472.description:
The players will be able to choose the two dimensional shapes.

The object of the game is to collect the sides needed to create the surfaces of the shapes on the green cards. For example, if you were collecting the sides of a cube you would collect and group six square side cards. You can collect the sides of more than one shape at a time if you choose!
The game ends when a player plays all of her cards and wins or the time for the game runs out. If time runs out, add up the points on the cards in your hand. Subtract ten points for every stack of sides you successfully played in front of you during the game. The player with the LEAST number of points wins!

Components:
134 cards
- 8 green 3-d shape cards.
- 96 blue 2-d surface or side shape cards
- 30 flat red flexible building blocks

66473.name: GODSEND Agenda Booster Deck!
66473.description:
Intructions for use:

The Booster Deck is very easy to use and enhances any GODSEND Agenda game.

All players are dealt 3 cards for the scene. A scene is described as ONE entire combat (not combat round) or
New cards are dealt at the beginning of every scene to replenish a player's hand back up to three.
Cards can be discarded for new cards at the beginning of the scene.
At the beginning of the scene players may confer and trade cards among one another but after this is done no further trading between players is allowed.
The game master is dealt 2 cards for every player. His cards are not attached to any one NPC and may be freely used among all NPCs.
One card per player may be played per round at any time on any appropriate situation. The game master may play one card per NPC per round as well.
Once a card is used it goes into the discard pile.




Once a scene is over all discarded cards are shuffled into the deck.

All player actions while using the cards must be described in cinematic detail or the benefit of the card is forfeit.

66474.name: Wildflower Rummy
66474.description:
To help learn Latin names, Genus/species, and descriptions of common wildflowers found in San Diego County.

Gameplay is similar to rummy.

Components:
50 cards

66475.name: Womb to Tomb
66475.description:
The players will be able to identify factors, traits, and lifestyles which contribute to life longevity or early death. They will be able to state whether the trait or lifestyle has a negative or positive effect on life span.

The object of the game is to get two different types of cards for each of the seven suits. When this occurs the player calls rummy. A player cannot call rummy if the cards are duplicates or make contridictory statements within the suit. For example "A nondrinker card and a heavy drinker card"

Each player starts arbitarily with 70 years. Score is computed once someone rummies. When rummy occurs, the person getting rummy receives 15 extra years of life. Each player totals their plus and minus years and adjusts their life span. Play may only be one round dealt(highest score wins), or can be accumulative over several hands. First one to 120 years(current actual record) is the winner, or when someone runs out of years the highest person wins.

Components:
108 cards

66476.name: Women's History Game
66476.description:
The player will be able to match famous women in American History with their historical importance (politics, labor, author, social work, or special interest).

Each of the other three players are given decks of equal fact cards. Players choose between blue, green or yellow. As the dealer lays down a face card, the players must lay down the appropriate fact card. Each player must lay down a card whether they are sure of their response or not.

After each player lays down a fact card, the dealer notes on a score sheet who won the round. There can be more than one winner for each turn and possibly there may be more than one winner for the game. The first person to lay down a fact card correctly wins that round and gains three points. At games end the total points are added up and the person with the largest score wins. To keep track of who was first, the first person to lay the correct card on top of the face card wins that round.

Components:
80 cards
- 40 face cards
- 40 fact cards

66477.name: World Citizen
66477.description:
The player will be able to identify the nationality of a person based on social interactions which include visual or written information about that person's country or culture.

Each player attempts to be the first to determine the nationality of the person described on the situation card and place a corresponding nationality card on the table. Each player must place a nationality card on the table OR forfeit one card to the discard pile. (Discarded cards remain out of play for the rest of the game). If two or more players place cards on the table simultaneously, then all cards for that play remain on the table and a second situation card is dealt over the first and players must attempt to match the second situation. Whomever wins the second play gets all of the cards on the table.

The GAME IS OVER when every situation card that can be correctly matched to a nationality card has been played. If a player runs out of nationality cards, she is out of the game until points are counted.

Components:
61 cards
- 25 Situation Cards
- 36 Nationality Cards

66478.name: Cocoa  A  Gogo
66478.description:
The object of the game is to earn the title of Cocoa-a-Gogo,the premier chocolate bean producer in the world.

There are two stages to the game. The first stage involves traveling around the outside track on the board collecting six cards ,resources needed to build your cacao plantation. In the second stage, it takes 20 beans currency to buy the way in, and is played inside the inner board; reaching the center is the key to win the game.

Cocoa a gogo is a Kids roll'n move family game: negotiation is the key to get the items (resources).

66481.name: Zero Out
66481.description:
The learner will be able to recognize and combine algebraic-like terms into sets of three. Each set will "zero out" (have a net value of zero).

Players sort their cards by types of terms. They position cards of like terms together. Players take turns drawing the top card from the remaining deck or selecting the top card in the discard pile. During each turn, a player must draw from either pile and discard one card before their turn is over. Each player tries to make two sets of three cards. Each set must contain cards of like terms that "zero out."

The player who successfully goes out, gets a score of zero. The other players will add the absolute values of the coefficients of the terms in their hands to determine their score. The player with the lowest total at the end of a set number of rounds, is the winner.

Components:
86 cards

66482.name: La France
66482.description:
User Summary:

La France is a French sourcebook for the Hawkmoon RPG. As the name implies, it describes the land that used to be called France before the Tragic Millenium.

The book includes an overview of France (and the surrounding countries) at the time of the Tragic Millenium, detailed descriptions of each region (Karlay, Loreine, the wild lands in the center of the country, Normandia, Gascoigne, Aquitior, Picardia, Lyonois, Alsaz, Begik, Oléan and Parye the Crystal City), descriptions of important personalities and scenario ideas for each province.

There are also rules for introducing Sanity rules (mainly borrowed from Call of Cthulhu), and a description of the different organizations and secret societies active in France.

66483.name: Seii Taishogun: Sengoku Karuto
66483.description:
Seii Taishogun: Sengoku Karuto is the seventh title available in Small Box Games' Pure Card Line.

Sengoku Karuto loosely borrows from the theme and mechanics of one of Small Box Games' most popular games, Seii Taishogun. Players are rival daimyo in Sengoku era Japan attempting to cleverly outwit eachother to gain control of various locations scattered across Japan's four main islands.

Unlike the original, each card represents one to three (1-3) samurai belonging to one of four clans and one of the following locations: temple, pagoda, or castle on one of the four islands of Japan. Players secretly assemble armies comprised of Samurai from one of four clans to conquer new locations. Armies constructed of Samurai from the same clan are more powerful than armies using various clans. Additionally, players can persuade locations to rally under their banners or attempt to conquer another player's locations.

Players are awarded points at the end of the game for the locations they've conquered, with additional points being awarded when various conditions are met.

66484.name: Mechanical Traps
66484.description:
From the publisher:

Have you ever wished you could kill off that annoying player quickly and easily, without arousing the suspicions of the other payers? Well now you can! E-Z DUNGEONS: Mechanical Traps gives you a whole selection of lethal goodies to stock your dungeon with. Slice 'em, dice 'em, dissolve them with acid, drown them, burn them, whatever you fell like! All traps feature our easy build designs and award winning texture art. Kill 'em all... you know you want to!

This PDF includes:

Flowing Acid Trap
Flowing Water Trap
Ceiling Blade Trap
Circular Saw Floor Trap (two versions)
Fire Trap (two sizes)
Floor Spike Trap
Lava Pit Trap
Water Pit Trap
Green Slime Pit Trap
'The Squasher'
Wall Blade Trap

66487.name: Chair et Métal
66487.description:
User Summary:

"Chair et Métal" (flesh and metal) is a campaign set in Sicilia (Tragic Millenium Sicily). It describes Sicilia in depth (including rules to create Sicilian characters), as well as the island of Malte, home to a mysterious order of knights.

The campaign itself is made of 5 scenarios linked together: "L'oeuf du Démon", Dans les Griffes du Dieu Rugissant", "Dans les Marais Sanglants", "Le Premier Sang" and "Représailles !".

66489.name: Strange Aeons II
66489.description:
From the publisher:

"The Great Old Ones were, the Great Old Ones are, the Great Old Ones shall be." That famous saying is the essence of the Cthulhu Mythos. The Great Old Ones are a cosmic evil that have existed since before time, and shall exist long after humanity has gone the way of the dinosaurs. This book illustrates the eternal struggle between man and the forces of the mythos.

This book contains nine scenarios that run the chronological gambit from prehistoric times to a distant future. Each adventure comes with six pre-generated characters for the players to use, allowing for quick play with a minimum of fuss. While each scenario is meant to be a standalone experience. Here are brief descriptions of the nine eras the investigators explore:

CURSED BE THE CITY can be described as cavemen vs. Cthulhu. While not entirely accurate, it is fun to say, and gives an idea of what the players will be up against.

CHILDREN OF A STARRY HEAVEN is set in ancient Greece, the birthplace of many great philosophers and thinkers. Unfortunately some great minds dwell on things man was not meant to know.

THEY DID NOT THINK IT TOO MANY See the might of ancient Rome bring law to the wilds of Britannia. Witness two cultures trying to learn from each other. Behold the terrible awfulness of the Mythos and how even the mightiest empire of man is powerless before it.

MASTER WU’S MARRIAGE a lovely springtime wedding, surly nothing bad can happen here. Unless the wedding takes place in Call of Cthulhu, then all bets are off.

THE IRON BANDED BOX set in feudal Japan, it’s like what would of happened if Akira Kurosawa directed an adaptation of a H.P. Lovecraft story. Beautiful, strange, messy, and with swords!

TO HELL OR CONNAUGHT it’s Protestant vs. Catholic, English vs. Irish, and mankind vs. the Cthulhu Mythos with Saint Patrick thrown in for good measure. Who will win? The smart money is on the Mythos.

A HARD ROAD TO TRAVEL set in the American Civil War, this scenario chronicles the horrors of war where brother fights brother and then everyone fights a cosmic horror beyond description.

THREE DAYS OF PEACE, MUSIC, AND TENTACLE LOVE Taking place at the Woodstock Music Festival in 1969 with sex, drugs, rock-n-roll, and black magic. A terrifyingly trippy time is to be had by all.

TIME AFTER TIME is a fractured scenario for fractured minds. Here the investigators will think many things, only to find them all false. Identities, locations, adversaries, even correct eras are all anyone’s guess here.

rpgpodcastepisode.102624: Call of Cthulhu: The Iron Banded Box

66490.name: Armor and Weapons
66490.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the first book in the Loot 4 Less line, where we deal exclusively in items with a cost-to-consumer of 2,500 GP or less. That's right: no epic artifacts, rods of eleventy parts or even typical moderate magic items here. This is a forum for the cheapest of the cheap, and that's it. And just to up the level of difficulty, we also don't deal in one-shot (or even two- or three-shot) magic items. No scrolls, potions, talismans or fire-and-forget tattoo magics here. Everything in these pages is a legitimate permanent magic item, free of charges and able to be used in adventure after adventure.

To kick things off, this first volume deals with weapons and armor, bread-and-butter items that everyone can use. Not only do we provide each magical enhancement with a full description and cost, we've scattered sidebars throughout the book to explain those costs. Each Behind the Counter sidebar explains how a price was arrived at, allowing GMs to apply the logic to other abilities (and be better able to change the pricing to match the needs of their campaign, with a firm knowledge of where the numbers come from).

66491.description:
Bonus Expansion to the Timber Tom board game.

This mini expansion adds the rare and protected Wollemi Pine to the mountainsides of Timber Tom. These special trees, once planted, cannot be removed! As your hiking adventure progresses, you may happen upon a Wollemi Pine (strategically planted by a rival hiker). Due to its protected status, you cannot remove this special tree from your path. Find another route!

Also, be sure to expend your stash of precious Wollemi "seeds" while hiking, otherwise you will be penalized when you return to base camp. Hikers are expected to help spread the rare Wollemis along the mountainsides.
66491.name: Timber Tom: The Wollemi Pines

66494.name: Rollespilsmagasinet ÆRA (Issue 1 - Jan 2010)
66494.description:
First issue of the periodical. This issue is primarily concerned with the Danish convention Fastaval. Many of the articles was taken from the internet (with the authors' permission).

Front and back cover by Morten Hauerballe Laursen (the front cover is called Necromancer).

66495.name: Viesca Melin Aella
66495.description:
From the publisher:

S.C.A.R.E. - Secrets, Contacts, Allies, Rivals and Enemies. They are part and parcel of the character generation process, and provide endless opportunities for adventure, intrigue and complication. The S.C.A.R.E. line gives you NPC's designed to provide maximum flexibility as they can be used in several ways; either as a valuable Contact or Ally, or as a dangerous Rival or Enemy. Secrets can be exploited for profit, patriotism or career advancement; and each could lead to danger, wealth or fantastic new discoveries. Multiple plot hooks and adventure ideas are also presented in each release, allowing easy integration into your game.

What do you get when you take a member of the Imperial family (in this case a grand-niece to the Emperor), add in the loyalty and training instilled by the Imperium's finest organizations, the unlimited authority granted by Imperial Credentials, access to bleeding edge technology, the unlimited resources to create multiple, bulletproof cover identities, and the contacts, networks and intelligence gleaned from hundreds of Imperial and Corporate agencies ? You have a Shadow Agent with the authority to arrest an Inquisitor, kill with impunity or start a war! Only a select handful are trusted with such authority, but they are the most fearsome and effective weapon in the Imperial arsenal.

Viesca Melin Aella is one of these "Shadows".

66496.name: Guard Post & Armory
66496.description:
From the publisher:

Every city needs a city guard, and they need somewhere to stash their weapons! DRAGONSHIRE: Guard Post & Armory provides a four level guard tower and armory, complete with weapon and armor racks, opening trap doors, ladders and more. Our exclusive DRAGON LAYERS options allow you to customize the building textures before printing. Easy to build, this fully detailed building is a perfect addition to your Dragonshire city!

66497.name: City Interiors
66497.description:
From the publisher:

DRAGONSHIRE: Interiors takes our award winning E-Z Dungeons model designs above ground. Richly detailed walls and furnishings allow you to create building interiors for your campaign, from the stuffed dragons head mounted on the wall to the outhouse out back, we've got you covered. This set utilizes our all new 'E-Z Layout' designs, allowing you to lay out buildings on-the-fly during your game quickly and easily. These new subassembly designs allow you to make virtually any floorplan from a handful of basic shapes. New wall and corridor options give you greater design flexibility, and our new attachment techniques make securing your building design a snap. We have included multiple versions of some models for multiple skill levels, such as our pre-printed doors for beginners and more complex opening versions featuring our exclusive 'E-Z Hinge' design for advanced modelers.

66498.description:
Schweinefrass is a card game, in which you have to remember, which cards were played before.
You play your food-cards face down on one of 7 pigs.
If a player pales a food-card on a pig, with the same kind of food already played on it, he has to return the card to his hand and must draw a new.
The fisrt player with no cards left in his hand is the winner.
66498.name: Schweinefrass

66499.description:
From the publisher:
Robert's a great businessman, familiar characters take part in a duck Scrooge, organized by the thrill of competition, a businessman, to win a job Scrooge's group - the winner is the one who deserves the first million.
This game is monopoly/go for broke/payday/cashflow like game! The game goes around the board where players need to make decisions and some weird things, like to make a sound of money or what is the most expensive thing you know. Everytime when you get it right or other player think that you got it, then yu get the amount of money written on the card or on the spcae you are standing on!
Win, by getting a million!
66499.name: Roope-Setä Liikemiespeli

66500.name: Iskelmäkaraoke
66500.description:
From the publisher:
In this game, correct singing is not as important as convincing singing. The goal is to move on its own clubs, local karaoke cruises through every karaoke championship. On the way you present a well-known songs(finnish): "What to do with the special discs", "Sounds like the sea", "Do you know how sick" can you sing them or do you have the soap that is stuck in your throat? Other players are referees, and will have to present themselves convincingly if keep track of your performance sub-standard. The game has been carried out in collaboration with the popular songs in the radio. Words come with the game!
You win by getting right the all songs and by convincing the players about your singing abilties!
